Analyst.model_prompt: You are providing a framework and detailed information for a background introduction of TCL Electronics to a securities analyst. During the service, you can ask the other party questions to obtain more information.
Analyst.information: TCL Electronics is a subsidiary of TCL Industries. TCL Corporation was founded in 1981, initially engaged in the production of magnetic tapes, and entered the television industry in 1992 with the launch of its flagship large-screen color TV. In 2004, TCL Corporation was listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, and its business currently covers smart terminal products, semiconductor displays and materials, new energy, and other fields. In 2019, it was reorganized into TCL Technology and TCL Industries, with TCL Electronics belonging to TCL Industries. The actual controller is Li Dongsheng, the founder of TCL Technology Group. TCL Electronics mainly engages in display, internet, and innovative businesses. Among them, the display business is the company's main business, accounting for more than 80% of the company's total revenue. Internet business revenue comes from video platform membership fees, vertical content, and overseas TV system service revenue sharing. Innovative businesses include full-category home appliance marketing, photovoltaic business, and smart home.
Analyst.needs: Introduction to the background information of TCL Electronics, including the establishment time, development history, major milestones, and core business distribution.

TCL Electronics' revenue and profit data are as follows:
1. Total revenue in 2020 was 463,671,600 yuan, display business revenue was 360,625,800 yuan, internet business revenue was 11,223,600 yuan, smart mobile, connected devices and services revenue was 47,223,900 yuan, smart commercial display, smart home and other business revenue was 44,668,300 yuan.
2. Total revenue in 2021 was 689,123,200 yuan, display business revenue was 589,945,900 yuan, of which large stack display revenue was 458,289,700 yuan (China market was 120,435,800 yuan, international market was 326,353,900 yuan), medium and small stack display revenue was 130,786,500 yuan, smart commercial display revenue was 2,793,700 yuan; innovative business revenue was 77,768,600 yuan, internet business revenue was 16,825,900 yuan (China market was 13,561,000 yuan, international market was 3,264,900 yuan), other revenue was 4,582,800 yuan.
3. 6. Net profit attributable to shareholders: 1,184 million HKD in 2021, 447 million HKD in 2022, a year-on-year decrease of 62.2%.
7. Adjusted net profit attributable to shareholders: 348 million HKD in 2021, 704 million HKD in 2022, a year-on-year increase of 102.4%.
8. Proposed final dividend per share: 16.70 HK cents in 2021, 12.70 HK cents in 2022, a year-on-year decrease of 24.0%.

Analyst.model_prompt: You are providing a framework for forecasting the long-term and short-term profitability of TCL Electronics to a securities analyst. During the service process, you can ask the other party questions to obtain more information.
Analyst.information:
TCL Electronics' profit fluctuation factors are as follows:
1. In 2022, display business revenue decreased from HKD 63.949 billion in 2021 to HKD 57.907 billion, a year-on-year decline of 9.4%, mainly due to the impact of external environments such as global geopolitical risks, energy crises, and inflation, leading to weak global consumer market demand, especially the decline in revenue from small and medium-sized displays and large overseas displays.
2. In 2022, internet business revenue was HKD 2.298 billion, a year-on-year increase of 24.3%, with a gross profit margin of 50.5%, a year-on-year decrease of 5.9 percentage points, mainly due to the increased proportion of innovative business revenue, which has relatively lower gross profit.
3. Net profit fluctuated significantly, with post-tax profit in 2022 being HKD 554 million, a decrease of 56.7% from HKD 1,279 million in 2021. The net profit attributable to the parent company in 2022 was HKD 447 million, a year-on-year decrease of 62.2%. After adjustment, the net profit attributable to the parent company was HKD 704 million, a year-on-year increase of 102.4%.
4. Panel prices are a key factor in TV production costs, accounting for 60% of production costs. In the future, panel prices are expected to stabilize, with significant pressure on both supply and demand in the short term, and the long-term trend towards larger screens may reduce the impact on overall profit margins.
Analyst.needs: Analysis of TCL Electronics' long-term and short-term profitability, with a short-term focus on costs and a long-term focus on demand, combined with a comprehensive forecast based on the company's three-year net profit and revenue data.

Analyst.model_prompt: You are providing a detailed introduction of TCL Electronics' display business to a securities analyst. During the service process, you can ask the other party questions to obtain more information.
Analyst.information: TCL Electronics' display business involves multiple product categories, including LED TVs, QLED TVs, OLED TVs, 8K Ultra HD TVs, smart TVs, and professional displays. According to different TV display technologies, they are divided into two main routes: LCD (liquid crystal display) and OLED (organic light-emitting diode). LCD technology can be further divided into regular LED, Mini LED, and QLED based on different backlight modules, while OLED is a self-emitting technology. LCD technology has relatively lower costs, but its brightness limit, contrast ratio, and color gamut width are not as good as OLED. OLED, on the other hand, offers higher contrast ratio, wider color gamut, and greater screen flexibility.
Analyst.needs: Introduction to TCL Electronics' display business, covering core product categories and the technological roadmap for TV displays.

According to Omdia's data, global TV shipments in 2022 were 200 million units, a year-on-year decrease of 5.6%, and shipments in the first half of 2023 were 90 million units, a year-on-year decrease of 1.7%.

In the first half of 2023, TCL Electronics' global market share reached 12.6%, ranking third globally.
3. In multiple overseas markets, TCL's market performance is outstanding. In the North American market, TCL quickly opened up the market in cooperation with Roku and gradually covered major channels such as Amazon and Costco. According to data from Q1-Q3 2023, TCL ranks high in several emerging markets such as the Philippines, Pakistan, and Myanmar, and also has a high market share in European markets such as France, the Czech Republic, and Sweden.
4. From the perspective of product structure, in 2023, TCL's quantum dot products accounted for 8.8%, products ≥65 inches accounted for 23.5%, and 4K products accounted for 65.3%. TCL is continuously strengthening its layout in large-size and high-end TV products to meet the demand of overseas markets.

For the whole year of 2023, TCL smart screens' shipment volume in the Chinese market decreased by 4.3% year-on-year, but the shipment volume in the second half of the year increased by 24.8% compared to the first half, with a quarter-on-quarter growth of 33.0% in the fourth quarter, driving annual revenue to grow by 5.4% year-on-year, reaching HKD 16.016 billion.

4. According to CMM data, TCL's quantum dot and Mini LED smart screens ranked first in retail volume across all channels in the Chinese market. With the improvement of product structure, the average retail price of TCL smart screens increased by 14.4% year-on-year, far exceeding the industry average (the overall industry increased by 4.6%).

Financial Sector Trust News According to media reports: China Huarong Party Committee has recommended the removal of Shen Yiming from his positions as Chairman and Legal Representative of Huarong International Trust Co., Ltd., and his reassignment as a General Manager-level cadre, specifically responsible for risk resolution and disposal related work of the trust company. A person responsible for information disclosure at Huarong Trust confirmed that the company has indeed recently received the relevant recommendation letter from China Huarong. Whether to accept the recommendation regarding Shen Yiming's appointment and removal depends on the decisions of the board of directors and the shareholders' meeting. In the first half of 2018, Huarong Trust's net profit decreased from 554 million yuan to 157 million yuan, a decline of 71.7%. 
China Huarong is the largest asset management company in the country and a massive financial holding group, encompassing full financial licenses including banking, securities, funds, trusts, leasing, futures, and consumer finance. According to China Huarong's official website, as of the end of 2017, China Huarong's total assets reached 1.87 trillion yuan; net assets reached 182.6 billion yuan; in 2017, it achieved a net profit of 26.6 billion yuan; the average return on equity was 18.1%, and the average return on assets was 1.6%. 
Shen Yiming, Master’s degree. He has served as a clerk and deputy director-level clerk at the Beijing Branch of the People's Bank of China; deputy director-level clerk, deputy section chief, and section chief at the Business Management Department of the People's Bank of China; section chief, cadre at the principal section level, deputy director, deputy director of the office (deputy division level), section chief of the Financial Company Supervision Department, and director of the Propaganda Department of the Party Committee (principal section level) at the Beijing Banking Regulatory Bureau's Urban Commercial Bank Supervision Department, Non-bank Financial Institution Supervision Department, and Financial Company Supervision Department; assistant to the general manager of Beijing International Trust Co., Ltd., deputy secretary of the Party Committee, director, general manager, and secretary of the Party Committee of Huarong International Trust Co., Ltd. According to Huarong Trust's 2017 annual report, Shen Yiming's term as chairman seems to have started on July 29, 2016.

0_负面信息侦测.information: Guide: Original Title: 2019 "Fortune" China 500 List Unveiled Tonight, Fortune China released the latest "Fortune" China 500 list, evaluating the performance and achievements of the largest Chinese listed companies worldwide over the past year. .. {IMG:2} Original Title: 2019 "Fortune" China 500 List Unveiled Tonight, Fortune China released the latest "Fortune" China 500 list, evaluating the performance and achievements of the largest Chinese listed companies worldwide over the past year. The list is compiled by "Fortune" (Chinese edition) in collaboration with the Wealth Management Department of China International Capital Corporation (CICC). This year, the total revenue of the 500 listed companies on the list reached 45.5 trillion yuan, an increase of 14.8% over last year, setting a new record; net profit reached 3.625 trillion yuan, an increase of 4.21% over last year. Compared to last year's growth rate of 24.24%, it has significantly slowed down due to the impact of the macroeconomic environment. The revenue threshold for companies on the list this year is 16.238 billion yuan, an increase of 17% compared to last year. Last year, China's GDP exceeded 90 trillion yuan for the first time, and the total revenue of these 500 listed companies once again exceeded half of China's GDP for the year. The leading companies on the list remain: Sinopec, PetroChina, and China State Construction. Ping An Insurance continues to be the top non-state-owned enterprise. This year, there are a total of 42 new and re-listed companies, among which Xiaomi Group ranks 53rd with a total revenue of 174.9 billion yuan. Meituan Dianping ranks 140th with a revenue of 65.2 billion yuan. In the food industry, Haidilao, which entered the 500 list for the first time this year (ranked 482nd), attracted much attention with a total revenue of 17 billion yuan in 2018. Additionally, TAL Education Group (ranked 483rd) became the first education industry enterprise to make it to the China 500 list. In terms of industries, the internet services sector led by Alibaba and Tencent, although accounting for only 2% of the total revenue of all 500 companies, has a market value close to 11 trillion yuan, accounting for 23.7% of the total market value of the China 500. According to CICC analysis: affected by the economic cycle, the overall performance of the more traditional real estate and financial industries was weak over the past year. The new economy sector, composed of electronics, internet services, and computer-related industries, continued its previous high growth trend, with the number of listed companies increasing to 37, and sector revenue growing by 29% year-on-year. For more analysis, please see the summary from the CICC research team at the end of the list. In terms of profitability, similar to last year, the top 10 most profitable listed companies, besides several major commercial banks and insurance companies, remain China Mobile Limited, Tencent Holdings Limited, and Alibaba Group Holding Limited. These ten companies achieved a total profit of 1.46 trillion yuan last year, accounting for 40.3% of the total profit of all listed companies. In 2019, a total of 30 companies in the China 500 were unprofitable, with total losses reaching 177.1 billion yuan. Meituan Dianping, which made the list for the first time this year, topped the loss list with a loss of nearly 115.5 billion yuan. Last year's new entrant iQIYI had a loss of 9.4 billion yuan. Among all listed companies, Guangdong Shaogang Songshan Co., Ltd. retained the top spot on the ROE list. Seven of the top ten companies last year were in the steel industry, and five of them remain in the top ten of the ROE list this year. ——Editorial Department 1 China Petroleum & Chemical Corporation Revenue (million yuan): 2,891,179 {IMG:3} March 13, 2019, Guangzhou, Guangdong. An intelligent explosion-proof inspection robot walking at the South China Nansha Oil Transfer Station of Sinopec Sales. Image source: Visual China 5 SAIC Motor Corporation Limited Revenue (million yuan): 902,194.06 {IMG:4} May 10, 2019, Shanghai. China Brand Day, SAIC Maxus G20FC hydrogen fuel cell vehicle, hydrogen fuel vehicle chassis display. More exciting news click Total 6 pages 12 next page Entity: Ping An Insurance

0_负面信息侦测.information:
Xi'an Terracotta Warriors Online, February 25th - Penguin Technology receives a billion-yuan strategic investment from Ant Financial. Penguin Technology received nearly a billion-yuan strategic investment from Ant Financial last November. This round of financing will be used for market expansion and technology research and development. It is reported that in April 2018, Penguin Technology received angel round financing from Shanghai Xiaoji Technology and Hangzhou Hot Shop. Penguin Technology was established in November 2017 and is an intelligent IoT platform service provider integrating independent research and development, commercial operations, and cooperative promotion. The company uses an intelligent IoT technology platform to empower commercial laundry equipment, providing integrated IoT transformation solutions and SaaS mobile payment solutions for self-service laundry operators. {IMG:1} On the user side, users can access the surrounding locations of laundry rooms and check the working status of machines through the Alipay mini-program. Users only need to make a reservation and pay by scanning a code with their mobile phones to experience the integrated self-service laundry and drying service. The hardware upgrade has improved the consumer experience and simultaneously met the consumption upgrade. On the merchant side, merchants only need to follow the Penguin Technology merchant platform and click on the merchant backend to view their earnings. At the same time, merchants can also check the fault status of each machine through the management backend, achieving remote control and maintenance. Penguin Technology not only helps traditional self-service laundry merchants upgrade their hardware but also provides different operational strategies based on the business conditions of each merchant through big data analysis on the intelligent IoT platform, thereby increasing merchant revenue. Currently, Penguin Technology has connected 100,000 campus self-service washing machines in more than 1,000 universities across 216 cities. The main application scenarios are campuses, communities, and factories. Huabei Withdrawal Official Customer Service QQ: 3600139439 {IMG:1} On the evening of August 14, Toread Holdings Group Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Toread), the first stock in outdoor products, announced its 2018 semi-annual report. Data shows that during the reporting period, the listed company's revenue and net profit both declined, and operating cash flow was also insufficient, making the performance quite dismal. The reason may be related to the failure of Toread's diversified layout strategy. 
    Poor sales and dismal performance may be due to the company's distraction 
    Recently, Toread announced its 2018 semi-annual report. Performance data shows that in the first half of this year, the company's operating income was 877 million yuan, a decrease of 31.38% compared to the same period last year; the net profit attributable to shareholders of the listed company was 24.12 million yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 69.47%; after deducting non-recurring gains and losses, the net profit attributable to shareholders of the listed company was 6.35 million yuan, a year-on-year decline of 89.02%, only a quarter of the net profit attributable to the parent company. 
    Toread's revenue and net profit both declined, and the performance was not very satisfactory. In this regard, the company explained that it was mainly due to the sharp decrease in international air tickets for travel services in China and the substantial increase in inventory write-downs during the reporting period compared to the same period last year. 
    In fact, this is not the first time Toread's performance has suffered. 
    Since 2015, Toread's net profit has shown a downward trend. The net profits attributable to the parent company in 2015, 2016, and 2017 were 263 million yuan, 166 million yuan, and -84.85 million yuan, respectively, a year-on-year decrease of 10.50%, 37.13%, and 151.24%. In the first half of this year, the company's product gross profit margin slightly increased, preventing a further decline in net profit, but it still could not reverse the performance downturn in recent years.
Entity: Huabei

The Group's consistent intention is to provide its users with a one-stop solution combining payment, equity, and credit services. The Group operates stably and compliantly, receiving recognition and commendation from regulatory authorities. The loss during the period was due to the loss from early redemption of convertible bonds, loss from the sale of subsidiaries, impairment loss of goodwill and equity in associates, share-based payment costs, spin-off expenses, and interest expenses related to bonds and convertible bonds. After the successful activation of JD Baitiao, the system will provide a Baitiao credit limit based on a comprehensive evaluation of the information you have provided. Before successful activation, it is not possible to check the credit limit or intervene manually.
Currently, the JD Baitiao service is open to all JD members. Residents of mainland China aged between 18 and 55 can try to apply for JD Baitiao through the JD Finance App. Once the application is approved, you can enjoy the JD Baitiao service. The same ID card and phone number can only activate one Baitiao account.
The JD Baitiao credit limit is comprehensively determined based on the applicant's consumption level and frequency in JD Mall, membership level, and other information.
The maximum JD Baitiao credit limit is 15,000 yuan, and it varies for each user. The general JD Baitiao credit limit ranges from 3,000 yuan to 6,000 yuan, while the JD Campus Baitiao credit limit generally ranges from 3,000 yuan to 8,000 yuan. You can see the specific JD Baitiao credit limit after you activate JD Baitiao.
Currently, JD Baitiao does not support proactive applications to increase the credit limit. JD will adjust the credit limit based on the usage and consumption situation of JD Baitiao members. Therefore, the usage and consumption situation is key to increasing the JD Baitiao credit limit.
Of course, there are always exceptions. This does not mean that the JD Baitiao credit limit cannot be increased at all. As long as JD Baitiao users pay more attention to JD dynamics, it is still possible to achieve an increase in the JD Baitiao credit limit.
South Wealth Network WeChat ID: South Wealth Network
Entity: JD Baitiao

Online Lending Eye News: On April 5, the Yuhang District Branch of the Hangzhou Public Security Bureau reported the latest progress of the P2P platform Stone Finance, with 13 people being prosecuted by the procuratorate and a total of 406 million yuan in frozen funds. ? According to the police report, the Yuhang District Public Security Branch has transferred 13 criminal suspects including Zhang Moubin and Yang Mouyi to the Yuhang District People's Procuratorate for review and prosecution. At the same time, an additional 106 million yuan of funds related to the case company and personal accounts were frozen, bringing the total frozen funds to 406 million yuan (including waiting freezes). An additional 1.2 million yuan of the suspect's illicit money was frozen, and the platform's related loan assistance company's loans are being collected in an orderly manner. ? In addition, the police also stated that after the case is transferred for review and prosecution, the public security organs will continue to recover stolen goods and losses, accelerate the audit process, and the public security organs will also announce the progress of the case in real-time. ? {IMG:1} ? On July 13 last year, Stone Finance issued an announcement stating that there was a delay and promised not to run away or lose contact. Securities Code: 601788
Company Attribute: Private Enterprise
Company Profile: Everbright Securities Co., Ltd. (referred to as "Everbright Securities") was established in 1996, headquartered in Shanghai. It is one of the first three innovative pilot securities companies approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission and one of the core financial service platforms of the Fortune Global 500 company, China Everbright Group Co., Ltd. (referred to as "Everbright Group"). Everbright Securities was listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange and the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on August 18, 2009, and August 18, 2016, respectively (stock codes: 601788.SH/06178.HK), making it an A+H share listed securities firm. Over the past 28 years, Everbright Securities has experienced and witnessed the development, innovation, and reform of China's capital market. The company fully leverages the synergy and brand advantages of Everbright Group, adhering to the development philosophy of "focusing on core business development, maintaining steady progress, promoting balanced development, strengthening coordinated development, and achieving safe development," and follows the path of financial development with Chinese characteristics. As of the end of 2023, Everbright Securities had 14 branches and 242 securities business departments, distributed in 121 cities (including county-level cities) across 30 provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities. The company has built six business clusters around retail customers, institutional customers, and corporate customers, including wealth management, corporate financing, institutional clients, investment trading, asset management, and equity investment. In 2023, the company received awards such as the "Regional Service Featured Underwriter" from the Shanghai Stock Exchange, the "Outstanding Non-bank Underwriting Institution for Local Bonds" from China Central Depository & Clearing Co., Ltd., the "Excellence Award for Best Investment Advisor" at the 6th New Fortune Best Investment Advisor Awards, the "Outstanding Service to the Real Economy Practice Case" from Xinhua Net's 2023 Corporate ESG Awards, and the "Most Popular APP Award in the Securities Industry" Golden Tripod Award for 2023. The company's brand awareness and social influence continue to rise. In 2024, Everbright Securities will adhere to Xi Jinping's Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics for a New Era, fully implement the spirit of the Central Financial Work Conference and the Central Economic Work Conference, anchor the strategic goal of "building a first-class service-oriented investment bank in China," and aim to serve the political and people-oriented nature of financial work, with the bottom line of preventing major financial risks. The company will uphold a balanced development strategy, truly realize its value in serving the real economy, and serve the "national needs" with "Everbright's capabilities."
Sector:
Business Scope: Securities brokerage; securities investment consulting; financial advisory related to securities trading and securities investment activities; securities underwriting and sponsorship; proprietary trading; intermediary introduction business for futures companies; agency sales of securities investment funds; margin financing and securities lending business; agency sales of financial products; stock options market-making business; custody of securities investment funds; other businesses approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission. (Projects that require approval according to law can only be carried out after approval by relevant departments. Specific business projects are subject to the approval documents or permits from relevant departments.)

With advanced innovative design, production manufacturing, quality management, and excellent service, Joyson Electronics has become a long-term partner of global automakers such as BMW, Mercedes-Benz, Audi, Volkswagen, General Motors, Ford, Honda, and Toyota, and has repeatedly won excellent supplier awards from automakers such as Porsche, Volkswagen, and General Motors.

Securities Code: 002116
Company Attribute: Private Enterprise
Company Profile: China Haisum Engineering Technology Co., Ltd. (Stock Code: 002116), abbreviated as China Haisum, is the first listed company in China's professional engineering design service industry and one of the large comprehensive engineering companies providing full-process services in the engineering field of China's light industry. China Haisum was established in 2002 after the overall restructuring of the original eight design institutes under the Ministry of Light Industry of the People's Republic of China, which were established successively in the 1950s. The company's controlling shareholder is China National Light Industry Group Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of China Poly Group Corporation, a Fortune Global 500 enterprise, and one of the six listed platforms under Poly Group. The company is headquartered in Shanghai and has 13 wholly-owned subsidiaries in key cities across the country, including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Changsha, and Wuhan. With nearly 70 years of profound heritage and development innovation, China Haisum has accumulated rich technical strength and management experience in the field of full-process engineering services. By continuously extending the entire industry chain, it is committed to providing customers with one-stop intelligent engineering services covering the entire process from consulting design, procurement and R&D, to construction and installation, commissioning training, and project operation and maintenance. Its business scope covers the whole country and more than 60 countries and regions worldwide. Securities Code: 601906
Company Attribute: Commercial Bank
Company Profile: Zheshang Bank Co., Ltd. is one of the twelve national joint-stock commercial banks. It officially opened on August 18, 2004, with its headquarters in Hangzhou, Zhejiang. It is the 13th "A+H" listed bank in the country. Since its opening, Zheshang Bank has been based in Zhejiang, looking globally, and developing steadily. It has become a high-quality commercial bank with a solid foundation, excellent efficiency, and comprehensive risk control. Zheshang Bank, with the vision of "a first-class commercial bank," comprehensively builds a five-character political ecology of "integrity, simplicity, professionalism, collaboration, and honesty," vigorously promotes the spirit of hard work, practices the three-character classic of "kindness, wisdom, diligence," adheres to the twelve-character business policy of "strengthening the foundation, adjusting the structure, controlling risks, and creating benefits," practices the concept of benevolent finance, takes digital reform as the main line, takes "deeply cultivating Zhejiang" as the primary strategy, and embarks on a new journey of high-quality development with new wealth management, large retail, large corporate, large investment banking, large asset management, and large cross-border business segments advancing together and developing comprehensively and collaboratively. In 2023, Zheshang Bank's operating income was 63.704 billion yuan, an increase of 4.29% over the previous year; the net profit attributable to the shareholders of the bank was 15.048 billion yuan, an increase of 10.50% over the previous year. Securities Code: 000812
Company Attribute: Private Enterprise
Company Profile: Shaanxi Golden Leaf Science & Education Group Co., Ltd. is a diversified group company with main businesses in higher education, tobacco product support, and medical care industries. The group headquarters is located in the core business area of the High-tech Industrial Development Zone in Xi'an, China, in the Urban Gate Building B. The group is a listed company on the main board of the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, with the stock abbreviation "Shaanxi Golden Leaf" (stock code: 000812). The group relies on Ruifeng New Material Technology Group as the operational management platform for the tobacco support industry, overseeing more than 10 entities including Yunnan Jinmingyuan Printing, Shaanxi Golden Leaf Printing, Shaanxi Tobacco Printing, Xinjiang Golden Leaf Technology, Hubei Golden Leaf Yuyang Chemical Fiber, and Shenzhen Golden Leaf Wanyuan Technology Development, with an annual output value of nearly 1 billion yuan. Its products cover more than 10 provinces including Shaanxi, Jiangsu, Yunnan, Xinjiang, and overseas markets such as Southeast Asia. Currently, it has 3 national-level testing centers, 3 provincial-level enterprise technology centers, and 1 municipal-level technology center, owning more than 100 intellectual property rights. It has successively won titles such as "Beijing International Packaging Expo High-tech Innovation Award", "Top 100 Chinese Printing Enterprises", and "National High-tech Enterprise". The group's education business started in 1999, jointly establishing the Golden Leaf Information Technology College with Northwestern Polytechnical University. In 2005, it was upgraded to an undergraduate institution, approved as a second-batch undergraduate institution in 2014, and in 2020, it successfully transitioned as one of the first batch of independently established private colleges in Shaanxi Province, renamed Xi'an Mingde Institute of Technology. In April 2020, entrusted by the Shaanxi Provincial Education Committee and the Department of Education, it successfully took over the management of Xi'an City Construction Vocational College. At the beginning of 2022, Mingdeyuan Education Technology Group Co., Ltd. was established to comprehensively integrate educational resources for group management and professional management of the education business. Currently, it manages two schools and 12 subsidiaries. The education business will expand from accommodating 12,000 teachers and students to a scale of more than 30,000 people, with teaching levels expanding from undergraduate to higher vocational, undergraduate to specialist, international education, and non-degree education. Taking advantage of the medical care policy opportunities, the group registered and established Handu Hospital Co., Ltd. in 2018, and in 2019, signed an agreement with the Xi'an High-tech Zone at the 4th Silk Road Expo to invest in the construction of Handu Hospital. The comprehensive tertiary hospital with the characteristic of "major specialties, minor comprehensive" was included in Xi'an's key construction projects in 2021. With the wind in our sails, we are forging ahead with new ambitions. At the historical intersection of the "Two Centuries", the group is currently unwaveringly implementing the strategic goal of "consolidating tobacco support, developing education, and cultivating medical care". Under the leadership of Mr. Yuan Hanyuan, Chairman and President of the Group's Board of Directors, all Golden Leaf people will unite and move forward bravely, striving to create a new era of development for the Golden Leaf Group.
Affiliated Sector:
Business Scope: Printing of packaging and decoration printed materials, high-tech digital printing technology and high-tech advertising production, high-tech industry, education, cultural industry, infrastructure, real estate investment (limited to own funds), development; printing investment consulting; self-operated and agent import and export business of various commodities and technologies (except for commodities and technologies restricted or prohibited by the state); domestic trade; processing trade and "three supplies and one compensation" business; counter-trade and re-export trade; production and sales of chemical fiber textiles, alloy slices, rock drilling tools, cigarette filter materials; research and development of new chemical fiber materials.

Company Profile: China Haisum Engineering Technology Co., Ltd. (Stock Code: 002116), abbreviated as China Haisum, is the first listed company in China's professional engineering design service industry and one of the large comprehensive engineering companies providing full-process services in the engineering field of China's light industry. China Haisum was established in 2002 after the overall restructuring of eight design institutes under the former Ministry of Light Industry, which were established successively in the 1950s. Its business scope covers the whole country and more than 60 countries and regions worldwide. Company Profile:
Shanghai Pudong Development Bank Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "the Bank") is a joint-stock commercial bank established on August 28, 1992, registered in Shanghai, People's Republic of China, with its headquarters located at No. 12, Zhongshan East 1st Road, Shanghai. It officially opened on January 9, 1993. On November 10, 1999, the Bank's RMB ordinary shares were listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange. The Bank and its subsidiaries (hereinafter collectively referred to as "the Group") mainly belong to the financial industry, with a primary business scope approved by the People's Bank of China and the National Financial Supervision and Administration (hereinafter referred to as "the Financial Supervision Administration"), including commercial banking, financial leasing, trust business, wealth management, and investment banking and asset management businesses as specified by the relevant licenses issued by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission. The Bank's main regulatory body is the Financial Supervision Administration, and the Bank's overseas branches and subsidiaries must also comply with the regulatory requirements of their operating locations. In July 2023, the British magazine "The Banker" released the "Top 1000 World Banks" ranking, and based on Tier 1 capital, SPD Bank ranked 18th globally and 9th among Chinese banks on the list. In August 2023, the American magazine "Fortune" released the "Fortune Global 500" ranking, and SPD Bank ranked 260th, 8th among Chinese banks on the list. In June 2023, the American magazine "Forbes" released the "Global 2000" ranking, and SPD Bank ranked 115th, 16th among Chinese enterprises on the list, and 9th among Chinese banks.

The group relies on Ruifeng New Material Technology Group as the operational management platform for the tobacco support industry, overseeing more than 10 entities including Yunnan Jinmingyuan Printing, Shaanxi Jinye Printing, Shaanxi Tobacco Printing, Xinjiang Jinye Technology, Hubei Jinye Yuyang Chemical Fiber, and Shenzhen Jinye Wanyuan Technology Development, with an annual output value of nearly 1 billion yuan. Its products cover more than 10 provinces including Shaanxi, Jiangsu, Yunnan, Xinjiang, and overseas markets such as Southeast Asia. It currently has 3 national-level testing centers, 3 provincial-level enterprise technology centers, and 1 municipal-level technology center, owning more than 100 intellectual property rights. It has successively won titles such as "Beijing International Packaging Expo High-tech Innovation Award", "Top 100 Printing Enterprises in China", and "National High-tech Enterprise". The group's education business started in 1999, jointly establishing Jinye Information Technology College with Northwestern Polytechnical University, which was upgraded to an undergraduate institution in 2005, approved as a second-batch undergraduate institution in 2014, and successfully transformed into an independently-run private college in Shaanxi Province in 2020, renamed Xi'an Mingde Institute of Technology. In April 2020, entrusted by the Shaanxi Provincial Education Working Committee and the Department of Education, it successfully took over the management of Xi'an City Construction Vocational College. At the beginning of 2022, Mingdeyuan Education Technology Group Co., Ltd. was established to fully integrate educational resources for group management and professional management of the education business. The comprehensive tertiary hospital with the feature of "large specialty, small comprehensive" was included in Xi'an's key construction projects in 2021. With the wind in our sails, we are forging ahead with determination. Industry_Report_Summary.information: This week, the National Bureau of Statistics released the 2023 investment and development investment situation of the real estate industry. In 2023, the sales area and sales volume of commercial housing were 1.12 billion square meters and 11.7 trillion yuan respectively, down 8.5% and 6.5% year-on-year. The industry scale continued to decline in 2023, with sales volume basically returning to the level of 2016, and sales area even returning to the level of 2012. Affected by factors such as the current weak expectations of residents' income and employment, some housing demand being overdrawn in the early stage, residents' concerns about the delivery of new houses, and the decline in housing prices exacerbating the wait-and-see sentiment, the real estate market is still hovering at the bottom, continuing a pulse-like recovery trend. At the same time, affected by many factors such as the continuous weakening of the volume and price of the real estate market, the continuous contraction of real estate enterprise financing, and the frequent occurrence of real estate enterprise thunderstorm risks, the supply side of the industry has shrunk significantly, and real estate enterprises' land acquisition and new construction have continued to be under pressure. In 2023, real estate development investment was 11.1 trillion yuan, down 9.6% year-on-year; the new construction area was 950 million square meters, down 20.4% year-on-year. The scale of development investment in 2023 returned to the level of 2018; the volume of new construction has reached the lowest level since 2008, down nearly 60% from the peak in 2019. Looking ahead to 2024, the recovery of the real estate market still depends on whether the expectations of home buyers can be restored, and there is still room for policy efforts on both the supply and demand sides. The two major projects of credit repair and the construction of affordable housing and urban village renovation may jointly promote the bottoming out and recovery of the real estate market. Real estate sales and investment in 2024 are expected to improve marginally, but the overall scale is expected to continue to operate at a low level. We believe that in the short term, attention should be paid to the actual effects and sustainability of the recent support policies, and in the medium and long term, attention should be paid to the industry opportunities brought by the promotion of urban village renovation and affordable housing construction. Under the current background, real estate enterprises with liquidity safety, heavy positions in high-energy cities, and outstanding product strength may have more α attributes. High-quality private enterprises with stable operations and mixed-ownership real estate enterprises may benefit from more targeted financing support policies in the future. If they can survive this cycle, they may have greater valuation repair flexibility. At this stage, we recommend focusing on four main lines: 1) Central and state-owned enterprises with no liquidity risk and good land acquisition and sales fundamentals: Poly Developments, China Merchants Shekou, China Resources Land, C&D International Group, Yuexiu Property, Huafa Industrial, Greentown China. 2) Private enterprises with relatively high safety coefficients: Binjiang Group, Midea Real Estate. 3) Companies with bottom rebound and greater flexibility: Gemdale Corporation, Longfor Group. 4) Companies with urban village renovation and affordable housing construction, or REITs related theme opportunities: China Communications Real Estate, Urban Construction Development, China Enterprise, Nanshan Holdings. Risk warning: Real estate regulation upgrade; sales decline beyond expectations; financing tightening.

Industry_Report_Summary.information: November global semiconductor sales turned positive year-on-year, with the semiconductor industry set to experience a cycle upturn and innovation growth resonance. According to SIA data, November global semiconductor sales turned positive year-on-year for the first time after 15 months of year-on-year decline, confirming the upward cycle of semiconductors; at the same time, AI innovation is expanding from computing power infrastructure construction to AI phones, AI PCs, AIoT, and other AI terminals, which is expected to bring a new wave of growth to semiconductors. We believe that the semiconductor industry will experience a cycle upturn and innovation growth resonance, and continue to recommend leading companies in various sub-sectors such as JCET, Tongfu Microelectronics, SMIC, SG Micro, NCE Power, Yangjie Electronic Technology, and Silex Microsystems. Additionally, January is the intensive period for 2023 performance forecasts, and we suggest paying attention to companies with good downstream demand in 4Q23 such as Vanchip, Espressif Systems, Awinic Technology, and Southchip. Monthly Special: Lam Research - Global Leader in Semiconductor Wafer Manufacturing Equipment. Lam Research is a global leader in innovative wafer manufacturing equipment and services for the semiconductor industry, headquartered in the United States. The company is dedicated to the production, sales, refurbishment, and servicing of semiconductor equipment used in integrated circuit manufacturing, focusing on etching, deposition, and cleaning. FY23 revenue was $17.429 billion, with revenue from the memory industry, foundry industry, and logic/IDM industry accounting for 42%/38%/20% respectively. As of December 31, 2023, the company's market value was $103.227 billion. The company achieved FY1Q24 revenue of $3.482 billion (YoY-31.4%, QoQ8.6%), and expects FY2Q24 revenue to be $3.4-4.0 billion (YoY-35.6% to -24.2%, QoQ-2.4% to 14.9%). The company believes that the combination of long-term demand in the semiconductor industry and changes in industry technology will drive sustainable growth in the semiconductor equipment industry, while also increasing the addressable market for the company's products and services in deposition, etching, and cleaning.

Industry_Report_Summary.information: The rapid iteration of AI applications and the continuous construction of the HarmonyOS ecosystem are expected to drive a wave of adaptation for computer software and hardware devices. At the same time, the gradual introduction of regulatory policies and regulations within the industry will guide healthy development, safeguard technological advancements, and maintain a "recommended" rating for the computer industry. HarmonyOS native applications: On January 18, 2024, Huawei held the HarmonyOS Ecosystem Thousand Sails Launch Ceremony, officially opening the HarmonyOS Galaxy version to developers. The first batch of 200+ native HarmonyOS applications is under development, covering various fields such as lifestyle, travel, and finance, with the application landscape initially taking shape. We believe that the HarmonyOS Galaxy version is expected to ignite a wave of native HarmonyOS application development and adaptation. The market shares of HarmonyOS, Android, and Apple operating systems are expected to be reshuffled. For individual stocks, we recommend paying attention to Runhe Software (300339.SZ) and Talkweb Information (002261.SZ). Edge AI: Edge AI chips and lightweight edge large models have laid a good foundation for the development of edge AI. We believe that edge AI technology will continue to iterate, and edge AI will further integrate with smart terminals. On January 18, 2024, Google and Samsung jointly announced that they would bring generative AI functions to the Samsung Galaxy S24 series phones. This series of phones can achieve AI functions such as "search by circle," which can be seen as an innovative application of Google's multimodal large model Gemini on the edge. We believe that the development and application of such edge AI will drive the shipment volume of AI smart terminals represented by AI smartphones and AI PCs. For individual stocks, we recommend paying attention to Huaqin Technology (603296.SH) and Hygon Information (688041.SH). AI Agent: At Lenovo's press conference on January 17, 2024, Lenovo's personal Agent reappeared and is expected to officially meet users in three months. The upcoming application scenarios include knowledge Q&A, language translation, text-to-PPT, etc. We believe that AI Agent will continue to be implemented domestically in a GPTStore-like form. At the same time, AI Agent may be the next important form of generative AI applications, with broad application prospects in scenarios such as gaming, office work, and travel. For individual stocks, we recommend paying attention to iFlytek (002230.SZ) and Chinasoft International (301236.SZ). Risk warning: Domestic computing power construction falls short of expectations; risk of errors in cited data; AI smart terminal shipment volume falls short of expectations; delivery risk of native HarmonyOS applications; key companies' performance falls short of expectations; policy standard introduction speed falls short of expectations.

Industry_Report_Summary.information:
Entering the peak season for Spring Festival stocking and consumption, focus on the long-term allocation value of leading companies. Last week (2024.1.15-2024.1.19), the Shenwan First-Level Food and Beverage Industry fell by 1.08%, the Shanghai Composite Index fell by 1.72%, and the Food and Beverage Index outperformed the broader market. Leading companies have stable income, and with the downward trend in costs, their profitability remains resilient. Consumer confidence still needs to recover. In the future, with the continuous efforts of the "stable growth" policy, residents' consumption ability and willingness will gradually increase, consumption demand is expected to improve, and the industry will maintain a "recommended" rating in the medium and long term. 

Liquor: Last week (2024.1.15-2024.1.19), the liquor sector fell by 0.81%. Huangtai Wine Industry (+0.88%) and Wuliangye (+0.11%) led the gains, while Rock Shares (-6.93%) and Shui Jing Fang (-6.88%) led the declines. Currently, the liquor market has entered the peak season for Spring Festival sales, and liquor companies have gradually started their payment collection work. High-end liquor is performing steadily, and liquor company valuations are at relatively low levels. It is recommended to focus on industry leaders such as Kweichow Moutai (600519.SH); mid-to-high-end price band performers like Shanxi Fenjiu (600809.SH); and leading local liquor brands like Gujing Gongjiu (000596.SZ), Yingjia Gongjiu (603198.SH), Jinhuijiu (603919.SH), and Jinhuiyuan (603369.SH).

Mass Consumer Goods: Last week (2024.1.15-2024.1.19), all sub-sectors of mass consumer goods showed a downward trend, hitting new lows again, mainly due to weak recovery on the demand side and insufficient consumer confidence. From a fundamental perspective, the snack sector's performance growth is impressive. Ganyuan Foods, Three Squirrels, and Jinzi Foods have released performance forecasts, with net profit attributable to the parent company increasing by more than 50% year-on-year. We believe that the demand side of the mass consumer goods sector will continue to recover in 2024, and we are optimistic about the following three main lines: 

Main Line One: High-growth sub-sectors in the growth stage, such as pre-made dishes, compound seasonings, and snacks. Focus on Anjoy Foods (603345.SH), Qianwei Central Kitchen (001215.SZ), Tianwei Foods (603317.SH), Jinzi Foods (003000.SZ), and Yanjin Shop (002847.SZ); 

Main Line Two: The beer sector, where the cost side is gradually improving and profitability is expected to increase. Focus on Tsingtao Brewery (600600.SH) and Yanjing Brewery (000729.SZ); 

Main Line Three: Industry leaders with stable recovery, high dividends, and high dividend yields. Focus on Yili Group (600887.SH).

Risk Warning: Food safety risks; consumption recovery not meeting expectations; rising costs; performance growth not meeting expectations; intensified industry competition; risk of deviation in third-party data statistics.

Industry_Report_Summary.information:
Last week, the media industry (Shenwan) fell by 1.67%, ranking 9th in the market, underperforming the CSI 300 Index. Apple MR device Vision Pro opened for pre-order. On January 19, Apple Vision Pro officially started pre-sale, with the first batch released in the United States. This product is equipped with the world's first spatial operating system visionOS, allowing users to control Vision Pro through hand, eye, and voice, providing a new 3D interactive experience. Starting with MR, it enhances the immersive experience through leapfrog innovation that integrates virtual and real. We believe that with the release of Apple's MR product, market attention to the MR industry will continue to increase, positively impacting the upstream software and hardware and downstream content and applications of the domestic industry, driving the entire industry ecosystem towards positive development. 

Games:
1) "Love and Deep Space" public beta begins. "Love and Deep Space" will start its global public beta on January 18. This time, Paper Studio's "Love and Deep Space" is a first-person 3D story game, innovating the way stories are presented, giving players a highly immersive romantic experience.
2) "2023 Game Security White Paper" released. In 2023, the actual sales revenue of the Chinese game market exceeded 300 billion for the first time, a year-on-year increase of 13.95%. Tencent Game Security, in conjunction with Tencent Security, Gamma Data, and DataEye, released the "2023 Game Security White Paper," aiming to provide comprehensive reference and guidance for the safe development of the game industry.
3) December 2023 global popular mobile game revenue TOP10 released. In December 2023, Scopely's "Monopoly GO!" grossed $219 million on the global App Store and Google Play, becoming the global mobile game sales champion for the first time. Tencent's "Honor of Kings" ranked second with $203 million in revenue, and Tencent's "PUBG Mobile" (combined with "Peace Elite" revenue) ranked third with $183 million in revenue. The other two games in the top five revenue list are "Roblox" and Dream Games' "Royal Match."
4) Douyin invests 5 billion to support mini-games in 2024.

Internet:
1) Apple opens third-party payments. On January 17, news came that Apple recently announced a relaxation of App Store policies, allowing U.S. developers to provide external links within applications so that users can make in-app purchases.
2) "2023 AIGC Mobile Market Insights" released. Data.ai estimates that in December 2023, related app downloads will reach a record high, exceeding 90 million, helping the annual total downloads of AI applications achieve a 652% growth, reaching 810 million. The growth of AI chatbot applications supported by AI technology is particularly significant, contributing 72% of the total downloads in 2023.

Investment advice: Policy guidance, hotspot driving, market expansion, and AIGC technology empowerment drive industry development.
1) Games: It is recommended to pay attention to leading companies with rich game reserves, strong R&D capabilities, and active layout of mini-games.
2) Film and TV series: In terms of movies, favorable policies help the film industry recover, focusing on leading cinema stocks; in terms of series, it is recommended to pay attention to video platforms focusing on member content production and outstanding performance in micro-short dramas.
3) AIGC: It is recommended to pay attention to companies that have already implemented AIGC applications.
4) Virtual reality: It is recommended to pay attention to companies that are laying out the content end of virtual reality.

Risk factors: Changes in policy environment; consumer recovery not meeting expectations; intensified market competition; innovative technology application not meeting expectations; goodwill impairment risk.

Industry_Report_Summary.information: Last week (1.15-1.19), the CSI 300 Index fell by 0.44%, while the Shenwan Communication Industry Index rose by 0.43%, ranking 2nd among the 31 Shenwan primary industries, outperforming the CSI 300 Index by 0.87 percentage points. It is recommended to focus on investment opportunities in sub-sectors such as 5G construction and applications, computing power, data centers, and satellite communications. Industry dynamics: (1) 6G: According to recent news on the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) website, ITU has released the standards and wireless interface technology framework for the sixth-generation mobile communication system (6G), laying the foundation for the development of next-generation mobile communications. The ITU Radiocommunication Assembly (RA-23) approved the ITU-R M.2160 recommendation on the "IMT-2030 framework," which includes detailed information on the 6G framework. 5043 (2) Cloud Computing: Relying on the "Trusted Edge Computing" evaluation system, the China Academy of Information and Communications Technology (CAICT) has selected domestic mature technologies and application benchmarks for edge computing and officially announced the 2023 Trusted Edge Computing evaluation results. Among them, Tianyi Cloud, China Unicom, Huawei, Alibaba Cloud, Tencent Cloud, and other companies passed the evaluation, with Tianyi Cloud and Alibaba Cloud performing exceptionally well, passing multiple evaluations. (3) Internet of Things: Quectel's Wi-Fi HaLow module FGH100M, developed based on Morse Micro's MM6108 platform, has been the first to obtain EU CE and North American FCC certifications. (4) Telecom Cloud Infrastructure: IDC predicts that global telecom cloud infrastructure software revenue will grow from $12.9 billion in 2022 to $27.3 billion in 2027. (5) 5G: By 2023, a total of 3.377 million 5G base stations have been built, and the number of ports capable of gigabit network services has reached 23.02 million. The foundation for the Internet of Everything is continuously being strengthened, with mobile IoT terminal users accounting for 57.5% of mobile network terminal connections. (6) Cloud Services: China's dedicated cloud services market grew by 26.6% year-on-year, with an overall market size of 15.43 billion RMB. (7) Intelligent Computing Centers: China Mobile recently launched the public procurement project for new intelligent computing centers (test networks) from 2023 to 2024, package 12, with the procurement content being 1,250 AI servers and supporting products. Industry valuation is below the historical median, and industry attention is rising: Last week (1.15-1.19), the Shenwan Communication Industry's transaction volume was 116.884 billion RMB, with an average daily transaction of 23.377 billion RMB, a 13.16% increase from the previous trading week. In terms of valuation, the current PE (TTM) of the SW Communication Industry is 18.05 times, lower than the historical average of 35.59 times since 2016. The performance of individual stocks in the communication sector was mixed last trading week: among 133 stocks, 29 stocks rose, and 104 stocks fell, with rising stocks accounting for 21.80%. Investment advice: The computing power upgrade brought by large AI models drives the development of industries such as servers, data centers, and optical modules; operators' digital business and cloud services have become new growth drivers. In the medium to long term, it is recommended to pay attention to investment opportunities in the satellite communication industry chain, artificial intelligence computing power industry chain, digital applications, and 5G construction. Risk factors: The uncertainty risk caused by Sino-US technological frictions on the industry; the development of 5G construction falling short of expectations; the development of the artificial intelligence industry falling short of expectations; the construction of the digital industry falling short of expectations.

Currently, China's insurance market shows diversity in the proportion of premiums for different types of insurance. Among them, life insurance premiums account for the largest proportion of premium income structure, reaching 52%. This reflects the increasing trend in demand for pension insurance as China's population structure enters the aging stage. As the aging of the population further intensifies, people's demand for post-retirement life protection is increasing, thus the pension insurance market has broad development prospects. At the same time, property insurance premiums also show a steady growth trend, accounting for 27%. This is mainly due to the rapid development of China's economy, and the increasing demand for property loss protection from enterprises and individuals. In addition, with the improvement of people's living standards and the acceleration of urbanization, insurance types related to automobiles, housing insurance, etc., have also developed rapidly, further promoting the development of the property insurance market. Moreover, health insurance premiums are growing rapidly, reflecting the importance Chinese residents place on personal health protection. This is related to the improvement of people's health awareness and the rise in medical expenses. As medical expenses continue to rise and people's attention to health increases, more and more consumers are choosing to purchase health insurance products to obtain better medical protection. Overall, personal insurance (including life insurance and health insurance) dominates the premium income structure. This is because personal insurance products provide family economic protection and personal health protection, with a high degree of protection. Therefore, whether in the life insurance market or the health insurance market, personal insurance products occupy a large market share. At the same time, with the improvement of Chinese residents' understanding and demand for insurance, the development prospects of the personal insurance market remain broad.

Industry_Report_Summary.information: Always prioritize ensuring national food security; global food price fluctuations drive up planting willingness and fertilizer demand. Food security is a "major national issue" and is an important foundation for achieving economic development, social stability, and national security. Since the 18th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, China's grain production capacity has been continuously enhanced. However, the basic national condition of a large population and limited arable land has not changed, and the foundation of food security is still not solid enough. The tight balance between grain supply and demand in China will not change for a long time, and ensuring the area of arable land will support domestic fertilizer demand. At the same time, in recent years, the rise in global food prices has increased the awareness of food security in various countries, which is expected to drive the willingness to plant and the demand for fertilizers globally. China's dependence on potash imports is high, and Chinese policies encourage enterprises to go abroad to seek potash. Due to the relative scarcity of potash resources in China and the difficulty in increasing production, China has long relied on potash imports. China has formulated a "three-thirds" strategy for the potash industry, namely one-third domestic production, one-third foreign imports, and one-third establishing overseas production bases to support the domestic market. Many enterprises, such as Zhonglao Mining, China Hydropower Mining, China Agricultural Minerals, Laos Kaiyuan Mining, Beijing Puyue, Haiwang Mining, and Sichuan Longmang, have "gone abroad to seek potash" and obtained exploration and mining rights overseas. Investment advice: In the short term, the spring fertilizer stocking season is approaching in March-April, and the potash affordability index has returned to normal levels, so the prosperity of the potash industry is expected to improve. In the long term, there is a mismatch between global potash resource supply and demand, and China's dependence on potash imports is high. Potash resource exploitation in Laos has significant advantages, and the overseas capacity deployment of domestic enterprises is expected to benefit. It is recommended to pay attention to enterprises involved in overseas potash resource exploitation and potash fertilizer production, as well as leading domestic potash fertilizer enterprises, such as Asia Potash International, Salt Lake Potash, and Zangge Mining. Risk warnings: Risks of policy changes; risks of raw material price increases; risks of sea freight price increases; risks of food price fluctuations.

From the perspective of profit elasticity, considering that many computer companies have reduced personnel investment since the second half of 2022; after entering the second half of 2023, the tail-end factors have basically ended; some companies' gross profit margins have stabilized or rebounded, and revenue growth has improved, showing a trend of net profit margin recovery, i.e., profit elasticity is higher than revenue elasticity, as evidenced by the performance forecasts of companies such as Wealth Trend, Streamax Technology, EZVIZ Network, and SuperMap Software. Industry_Report_Summary.information:
The 24-year interim report of the operators has been released, and emerging businesses are building a new growth inflection point. The semi-annual reports of the three major operators were completed this week, and various data indicators and business expansion conditions have maintained a stable and positive trend. From a performance perspective, the financial indicators of the three major operators performed excellently. In the first half of 2024, the operating revenues of Mobile, Unicom, and Telecom reached 546.744 billion yuan, 197.341 billion yuan, and 265.973 billion yuan, respectively, with year-on-year increases of 3.0%, 2.9%, and 2.8%; the net profits attributable to the parent company reached 80.201 billion yuan, 6.039 billion yuan, and 21.812 billion yuan, with year-on-year increases of 5.3%, 10.9%, and 8.2%. On a quarterly basis, the operating revenues of the three major operators in Q2 increased by 1.09%, 3.42%, and 1.98% year-on-year; the net profits attributable to the parent company increased by 5.17%, 13.04%, and 8.59% year-on-year. From a business perspective, for China Mobile, the revenue share of the HBN (home, government, and enterprise, emerging) market reached 45%, a year-on-year increase of 2.3%; the revenue from digital transformation reached 147.1 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 11.0%, and the proportion of main business revenue increased to 31.7% compared to the same period last year. For China Unicom, the revenue from network communication business reached 125.1 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 2.1%, ensuring the company's performance; cloud business revenue reached 31.7 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 24.3%. Overall, the three basic telecom operators achieved revenue of 227.9 billion yuan from emerging businesses such as IPTV, internet data centers, big data, cloud computing, and the internet of things, a year-on-year increase of 11.4%, becoming the most important engine for the company's growth. We believe that the steady growth of traditional C-end business combined with the continuous expansion of B-end business will become the main source of growth for various performance indicators of operators and may further catalyze the construction of a new growth curve for the company.

The Federal Reserve signals a rate cut, continuing to be optimistic about the forward movement of technology stocks. At the macro level, on August 23, Federal Reserve Chairman Powell said that the time for policy adjustment has come, and the labor market has cooled significantly from its previous overheating state, making it unlikely to become a source of rising inflationary pressure in the short term. According to CME Group's FedWatch data, the market bets that the probability of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates by 25 basis points in September is 73.5%, and the probability of cutting interest rates by 50 basis points is 26.5%; the probability of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates by a total of 50 basis points by November is 54.2%, the probability of cutting interest rates by a total of 75 basis points is 38.9%, and the probability of cutting interest rates by a total of 100 basis points is 7.0%. Affected by this, the three major U.S. stock indexes all closed higher, and technology companies such as Nvidia, Apple, and Amazon all saw varying degrees of increase. At the micro level, Nvidia will announce its second-quarter results on August 28, Apple plans to launch new iPhones, AirPods, and watches on September 10, and will increase testing efforts for MAC models equipped with M4 processors. We believe that with the rising "dovish" voices of the Federal Reserve and the intensified catalysis of news from large North American technology companies, domestic related technology enterprises and software and hardware industry companies are expected to achieve sustained benefits.

Recommended attention: Operators: China Mobile, China Unicom, China Telecom; Optical modules: Zhongji Xuchuang, New Yisheng, Tianfu Communication; Optical chips: Yuanjie Technology, Shijia Photon; Servers: Inspur Information, Sugon, Foxconn Industrial Internet; Chips: Cambricon, Haiguang Information, etc.

(hereinafter referred to as Altron) by issuing shares, and simultaneously raise supporting funds. The company's stock was suspended from trading starting from the market opening on September 4, 2020. (hereinafter referred to as Zhonglian Appraisal), and other intermediary agencies to carry out work related to the merger and acquisition project. Lin said that internal approval processes needed to be followed and a decision could only be made after discussions with Altron's shareholders. On the afternoon of December 15, 2020, Lin reported Zhang's suggestion to terminate the acquisition of Altron to the company's president and vice chairman, Chen Ping. On the same day, Lin contacted Tao from Zhonglian Appraisal and Zhang from CITIC Securities, informing them of the company's decision to terminate the acquisition. On December 17, 2020, Zhang posted a message in the WeChat group "Tianhe Project CITIC Internal Group" stating that after communication with the listed company, the Altron project was suspended. On December 22, 2020, Lin posted a message in the WeChat group "Tianhe Project (Listed Company and Intermediary Agencies)" stating the decision to terminate the Altron project. On January 8, 2021, Fuchun Co., Ltd. issued the "Announcement on Terminating the Issuance of Shares to Purchase Assets and Raise Supporting Funds" regarding the termination of the acquisition of the Altron project. On December 30, 2020, Chen Ping controlled the "Chen Ping" account to sell 1,065,397 shares of "Fuchun Co., Ltd." through block trading, with a transaction amount of 6,392,382 yuan, and the number of shares sold accounted for 100% of the shares available for sale. Insider_Trading_Detection.information: In 2019, Zhou, then the investment director of Huitianfu Fund, once recommended Siwei (Shanghai) Biotechnology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Siwei Biotech) as an investment target for tumor vaccines to Wang, a director of Tibet Pharmaceuticals, but it was not taken seriously at the time, and no contact was made between the two parties. On the evening of May 21, 2020, Guo Dong, general manager of Tibet Pharmaceuticals, and Wang, a director of Tibet Pharmaceuticals, discussed the COVID-19 pandemic and mRNA technology for COVID-19 vaccines with relevant personnel from the Drug Administration. Guo Dong believed that the vaccine project was a good investment opportunity. Wang recalled that Siwei Biotech, recommended by Zhou earlier, had this technology. After discussing with Guo Dong, Wang immediately contacted Zhou, expressing Tibet Pharmaceuticals' interest in developing a COVID-19 vaccine using mRNA technology and inquiring whether there was still an opportunity to invest in Siwei Biotech and collaborate on developing a COVID-19 vaccine. Zhou conveyed Tibet Pharmaceuticals' intention to cooperate with Siwei Biotech on COVID-19 vaccine development to Siwei Biotech's boss, Li Wen. Due to being very satisfied with Tibet Pharmaceuticals' conditions and resources, and coupled with Siwei Biotech's urgent need for funds at the time, Li Wen also had the intention to cooperate, stating that the cooperation matters could be discussed. After Zhou relayed the relevant information to Wang, Guo Dong reported the intention to carry out the COVID-19 vaccine project to Lin, chairman of the controlling shareholder of Tibet Pharmaceuticals, Consun Pharmaceutical Holdings Limited, and the actual controller of Tibet Pharmaceuticals. At the same time, Wang sent the recommendation materials of Siwei Biotech and its COVID-19 vaccine development information to Lin. Lin recognized the team and technology of Siwei Biotech and hoped to have a face-to-face meeting with them, considering that Siwei Biotech had signed a non-exclusive agreement with Shanghai Pharmaceuticals Group and wanted to advance the project as soon as possible. Following Lin's instructions, Wang coordinated the face-to-face meeting with Siwei Biotech's boss, Li Wen, through Zhou. On May 22, through Zhou's mediation, both parties agreed on a meeting time. On the evening of May 26, the actual controller of Tibet Pharmaceuticals and the main person in charge of Siwei Biotech met for the first time to discuss cooperation. Three directors of Tibet Pharmaceuticals and the deputy general manager of Siwei Biotech also attended the meeting. During the meeting, both parties enhanced mutual understanding, discussed cooperation models and cooperation terms, and reached an intention to further advance cooperation on the spot. From May 27 to May 28, both parties conducted specific business negotiations and reached a consensus on the investment amount and transaction plan. From May 29 to May 30, Tibet Pharmaceuticals conducted due diligence on Siwei Biotech. On June 1, both parties signed a formal cooperation agreement. On June 16, Tibet Pharmaceuticals announced an external investment, stating that it had signed a strategic cooperation agreement with Siwei Biotech, intending to pay 351 million yuan in stages to obtain the global exclusive rights to develop, produce, use, and commercialize their COVID-19 vaccine, tuberculosis vaccine, and influenza vaccine, with 350 million yuan for the COVID-19 vaccine and a 35 million yuan advance payment. The transaction amount in the announcement was 351 million yuan, accounting for 14.3% of the latest audited net assets of the listed company. On May 21, 2020, after understanding each other's situation and demands through the intermediary Zhou, both Tibet Pharmaceuticals and the actual controller of Siwei Biotech intended to cooperate and arranged a face-to-face meeting on May 22, which should be recognized as the formation time of insider information according to the law. The sensitive period for insider information was from May 21, 2020, to June 16, 2020. Lu, the director of new drug development at Tianjin Consun Pharmaceutical Technology Development Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Consun Pharmaceutical Holdings Limited, participated in the due diligence work of Tibet Pharmaceuticals on Siwei Biotech on May 29, 2020, and learned the insider information on that day, making him an insider in this case, with the knowledge time no later than May 29, 2020. Mei Jianxun and the insider Lu are husband and wife. According to the investigation, Lu actively called Mei Jianxun five times between May 29 and May 30, 2020, with a total call duration of 243 seconds. The "Mei Jianxun" China Merchants Securities account was opened on April 9, 2014, at the China Merchants Securities Tianjin Youyi North Road Securities Business Department. Mei Jianxun actually controlled the "Mei Jianxun" China Merchants Securities account, and the mobile phone number used to buy "Tibet Pharmaceuticals" stocks was Mei Jianxun's own mobile phone number, with all trading funds coming from his own funds. On June 1, 2020, Mei Jianxun bought 10,500 shares of "Tibet Pharmaceuticals" with this account, with a transaction amount of 359,051 yuan. After the announcement was released, he sold 5,000 shares on July 2, 2020, and sold all remaining shares on December 30, 2020. According to the exchange's calculation, the account made a total profit of 374,890.57 yuan from trading "Tibet Pharmaceuticals" stocks during the sensitive period. Before buying "Tibet Pharmaceuticals" stocks, the "Mei Jianxun" China Merchants Securities account had only traded one stock since its opening, with a transaction amount of only 2,000 yuan. The transaction amount of buying "Tibet Pharmaceuticals" stocks on June 1, 2020, was 180 times the total transaction amount of previous stock trades, with a significant increase in trading volume, and the proportion of buying "Tibet Pharmaceuticals" stocks and the proportion of holdings at the end of the period both exceeded 90%, showing a strong willingness to buy and significantly abnormal trading behavior.
Insider_Trading_Detection.needs: Determine whether Mei Jianxun constitutes insider trading, and explain the relevant legal or regulatory basis.

(hereinafter referred to as Xicai Institute). They provided a preliminary asset restructuring concept document to Nonferrous Mining Deputy General Manager Yan Mouyong, Enterprise Development Department Director Wang Mou, Securities Affairs Office Director Hao Mou, and Deputy Director Ma Mou, mentioning the proposed injection of Xicai Institute's assets into Orient Tantalum Industry. Yan Mouyong requested the Securities Affairs Office to get involved from the beginning to guide the work and to demonstrate the feasibility of the matter on-site. On December 13, 2017, Wang Mou, Hao Mou, and Ma Mou went to CNMC Orient to discuss major asset restructuring matters and preliminarily demonstrated the plan to inject Xicai Institute into Orient Tantalum Industry. Other attendees included Li Mouguang, Niu Mougang, and Yang Moujian from GF Securities Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as GF Securities). On December 29, 2017, Wang Mou, Hao Mou, and Ma Mou went to CNMC Orient for the second time to discuss major asset restructuring matters, discussing the key points and considerations of the preliminary plan proposed by GF Securities, clearly mentioning the restructuring with Xicai Institute as the target. Other attendees included Li Mouguang, Niu Mougang, and Yang Moujian from GF Securities. On January 15, 2018, Li Mouguang, Niu Mougang, and others went to Nonferrous Mining to report the overall plan of CNMC Orient's "turnaround and escape from difficulties," including the listed company's restructuring plan and the divestiture of Xicai Institute's non-military assets. From January 17 to 19, 2018, Hao Mou and Ma Mou went to CNMC Orient for meetings, mainly discussing the estimated impairment plan of the restructuring plan, the disposal of Xicai Institute's land, and the time to report to the relevant authorities. Other attendees included Li Mouguang, Niu Mougang, and others. On January 22, 2018, CNMC Orient issued the "Request for the Free Transfer of Non-Military Business Assets of Northwest Rare Metal Materials Research Institute Ningxia Co., Ltd." to Nonferrous Mining. From January 22 to 25, 2018, Li Mouguang and others went to Beijing to attend Nonferrous Mining's year-end work meeting, during which Li Mouguang discussed the matters involved in the restructuring plan with Hao Mou and Ma Mou. From January 25 to 27, 2018, Niu Mougang and others went to Nonferrous Mining to discuss the divestiture of Xicai Institute's non-military assets with Hao Mou and Ma Mou.
