Other attendees included Yan Mouyong, Wang Mou, Hao Mou, and Ma Mou. At the end of February and early March 2018, CNMC Orient reported to its shareholder Ningxia State-owned Capital Operation Group Co., Ltd. On March 12, 2018, CNMC Orient's leadership team held a meeting to discuss the restructuring matters and formed the final draft of the overall plan for turning around and escaping difficulties. On the same day, CNMC Orient and Orient Tantalum Industry signed the "Asset Acquisition Intent Agreement." On March 13, 2018, Orient Tantalum Industry disclosed the announcement of the suspension of major asset restructuring, stating that the listed company intends to purchase 100% equity of Xicai Institute held by CNMC Orient through a combination of issuing shares and paying cash. On the same day, "Orient Tantalum Industry" was suspended. On May 14, 2018, Orient Tantalum Industry disclosed the announcement of terminating the planning of major asset restructuring and resuming trading of stocks. On the same day, "Orient Tantalum Industry" resumed trading. According to the "Asset Acquisition Intent Agreement," the estimated value of the acquisition target, 100% equity of Xicai Institute, is about 1.8 billion yuan. The audited total assets at the end of the consolidated financial accounting report period for the 2017 accounting year of Orient Tantalum Industry were 2,043,014,700 yuan, and the audited net assets at the end of the consolidated financial accounting report period for the 2017 accounting year were 1,105,457,300 yuan. This insider information was formed no later than December 13, 2017, and was disclosed on March 13, 2018. Zuo Youqiang controlled and used the "Zhao Mou" account. Since the account was opened, the stock transactions of this account were all ordered through Zuo Youqiang's computer or mobile phone. Before contacting the insider, the funds used for stock transactions in this account all came from Zuo Youqiang's family funds. Before the disclosure of insider information, the IP address used for trading "Orient Tantalum Industry" in the "Zhao Mou" account was consistent with the fixed IP address of Zuo Youqiang's unit, Nonferrous Mining, and the MAC address was consistent with the MAC address of Zuo Youqiang's computer. On September 18, 2017, the "Zhao Mou" account transferred 200,000 yuan of Zuo Youqiang's family funds, with a balance of 200,002 yuan on that day, and no funds were transferred in until 2018. On January 24, 2018, the "Zhao Mou" account transferred 1,492,432 yuan from the tripartite custody bank account to the securities account; on the same day, this fund was transferred to the securities account; on the 25th, Zuo Youqiang's friend Zhang Mou's Bank of Communications 3069 account transferred 1,650,000 yuan to the "Zhao Mou" account's tripartite custody bank account, and on the same day, this fund was transferred to the securities account. The actual source of the above two funds was Zuo Youqiang's mother, Wu Mouxu. After contacting the insider and before the disclosure of insider information, Zuo Youqiang concentrated a large amount of funds to control and use the "Zhao Mou" account to buy 362,900 shares of "Orient Tantalum Industry," with a purchase amount of 3,141,550.97 yuan. Among them, on January 24, 2018, the "Zhao Mou" account bought 170,700 shares of "Orient Tantalum Industry," with a purchase amount of 1,446,469.97 yuan; on the 25th, it bought 175,300 shares of "Orient Tantalum Industry," with a purchase amount of 1,540,615 yuan; on the 26th, it bought 16,900 shares of "Orient Tantalum Industry," with a purchase amount of 154,466 yuan. Subsequently, Wang arranged for Vantone Real Estate Director Sun to conduct research with relevant personnel from Hongta Securities. On March 11, 2018, Hongta Securities sent the "Tianli Lithium Energy M&A Analysis Report V2", which detailed the industry in which Tianli Lithium Energy is located, capital needs, acquisition plans, etc. As a result, Vantone Real Estate expressed its intention to acquire Tianli Lithium Energy. On April 12, 2018, Vantone Real Estate and Tianli Lithium Energy signed a confidentiality agreement. Then, relevant personnel from Jia Hua Holdings, Hongta Securities, Xinghua Certified Public Accountants, and Wansiheng Law Firm went to Tianli Lithium Energy for due diligence. During the same period, Na Chuan Co., Ltd.'s investee company Qiyuan Na Chuan attempted to acquire the equity of Xingheng Power, but failed to complete it for some reason. At the beginning of 2018, the management of Xingheng Power believed that it was difficult for Na Chuan Co., Ltd. to acquire it, so they conducted a new round of capital increase and share expansion. In mid-April 2018, Jia Hua Holdings, recommended by Tianli Lithium Energy, initially contacted the private placement of Xingheng Power. After on-site inspections and investigations, Vantone Real Estate believed that Xingheng Power was a very good target. On May 28, 2018, Vantone Real Estate and the management of Xingheng Power formed the "Xingheng Power 1-3 Memorandum", including acquisition plans for the equity of the major shareholder Qiyuan Na Chuan, the equity of the management holding platform, gambling clauses, and commitments of listed companies. On August 25, 2017, Zhongrui Holdings and Haiyang Urban Investment signed the "Haiyang City New Energy Industrial Park Project Cooperation Investment Framework Agreement" to jointly invest in the establishment of an investment platform, aiming to participate in the equity investment of listed companies, and promote the development of the local new energy vehicle industry by becoming an important shareholder or even a controlling shareholder of listed companies. In October 2017, Yantai Zhongrui was established and formulated the "Yantai Zhongrui Acquisition Project Financing Plan," which described the situation of investors (Zhongrui Holdings and Haiyang Urban Investment) and the overview of the target listed company. Although the name of the listed company was not explicitly stated, the description in the plan was completely consistent with the fundamentals and financial data of Meiyan Jixiang Company. At the same time, Zhongrui Holdings formed an anonymous "Due Diligence Report on Listed Companies" in October 2017, and the content of the report was completely consistent with the basic situation of Meiyan Jixiang. On November 17, 2017, Yantai Zhongrui held a general meeting of shareholders and determined the specific investment methods, including funds for new energy vehicle project investment and for acquiring shares of listed companies. In December 2017, Qian Mouming signed a cooperation agreement with Zhongrui Holdings, which stipulated the transfer of Zhongke Guoyan Biotechnology Co., Ltd. to Yantai Zhongrui and assisted Zhongrui Holdings in financing and stock trading. On February 23, 2018, Meiyan Jixiang issued the "Indicative Announcement on the Simplified Equity Change of Company Shareholders," stating that Yantai Zhongrui and Zhongke Zhongrui together held 5.03% of Meiyan Jixiang's shares, becoming the company's largest shareholder. Mu Xiaohong met with Qian Mouming in Beijing on February 5, 2018, and used her Guorong Securities ordinary account (mobile order) to trade "Meiyan Jixiang" on February 6, 7, and 14, 2018. The account trading time points were highly consistent with the contact situation, and there was no legitimate reason or legitimate information source, with a total profit of 77,755.54 yuan.

The net profit attributable to the owners of the parent company after deducting non-recurring gains and losses is around 101.50 million yuan, an increase of approximately 74.59 million yuan compared to the same period last year (statutory disclosure data), a year-on-year increase of about 277%. In January 2021, Hotgen Biotech's main income still came from the overseas sales of medical reagents, but overseas income had already declined, and overseas sales revenue further decreased in February. On March 2, 2021, Hotgen Biotech's COVID-19 test reagent officially obtained the German home self-testing emergency use registration certificate. That evening, the number of orders from distributors via phone and email increased sharply, with an estimated order value of over 2 billion yuan. Investment_Strategy_Evaluation.information: January 19, 2024, from a technical analysis perspective, after the stock index accelerated its decline at the end of October last year and hit a new low for the year, it once showed a stable and gradual upward trend. The stock index experienced a technical rebound with a wave of oscillating upward movement. However, as the stock index repeatedly failed to challenge the 60-day moving average, it turned from strong to weak and showed a trend of oscillating decline, indicating that a round of oversold technical rebound had come to an end. At the beginning of the new year, the stock index continued its weak trend and accelerated its decline, with several major indices continuously falling and hitting new lows for the year, causing market confidence to suffer another severe blow. This week, the stock index continuously oscillated and adjusted. On Thursday, under the background of a general decline on Wednesday, the stock index accelerated its decline again and hit a new low for the year. The continuous sharp decline triggered a tentative entry of bottom-fishing funds from outside the market. The bulls leveraged the heavyweight stocks to create a trend of first suppressing and then rising. The significantly enlarged trading volume indicated a large divergence and fierce competition between the bulls and bears. The single-day bottoming out with increased volume on Thursday basically confirmed the short-term low point of the stock index. However, we also need to see the shortcomings of Thursday, that is, although the stock index turned red and rose, the number of declining stocks still significantly exceeded the number of rising stocks, indicating that the rise on Thursday was still dominated by heavyweight stocks. Currently, the short- and medium-term moving averages have formed a divergent bearish arrangement after converging, still exerting layer-by-layer resistance to the upward movement of the stock index. Although, as we expected, the stock index rebounded and rose on Thursday after continuously accelerating its decline, the overall weak characteristic of the market has not changed. The rise on Thursday was more based on a technical rebound after the stock index was continuously oversold. Therefore, it is expected that short-term wide fluctuations in the stock index may be unavoidable. Closely monitor the trends of the RMB exchange rate and the popularity index, grasp the market rhythm, control positions, and select individual stocks for operation.

In November, the monthly premium of life insurance companies decreased by 0.5% year-on-year, with a significant narrowing of the decline; health insurance premiums decreased by 3.1% year-on-year; property insurance premiums increased by 5.9% year-on-year, with stable growth in auto insurance premiums and a rebound in non-auto insurance growth. According to media reports, some insurance companies have lowered the settlement interest rate of universal insurance from 4.5% to 4%, some companies have lowered it from 4% to 3.5%, and a few companies have lowered it to 3%. Lowering the settlement interest rate of universal insurance is an independent action by the industry to reduce liability costs based on market conditions. In the context of a downward trend in market interest rates, some insurance companies have chosen to lower the settlement interest rate of universal insurance to prevent interest rate spread risk. This will further improve the transmission mechanism between the investment side and the liability side of insurance companies, releasing more space for insurance companies to serve the real economy. 3) The insurance industry's operations have significant pro-cyclical characteristics. In the future, as the economy recovers, both the liability side and the investment side will significantly improve. Investment_Strategy_Evaluation.information:
Currently, the driving factors for the price of onshore and offshore wind turbine units are mainly the large-scale capacity of the turbines, rather than the mere continuation of a "price war." The large-scale capacity of the units is an important way to reduce costs and increase efficiency for the entire machine, reflecting the technical competitiveness of the complete machine manufacturers. It also places higher demands on core components such as towers and main shafts, highlighting the competitive advantages of leading wind turbine and core component manufacturers. In addition, with the development of offshore wind power, the demand for large-megawatt units is gradually increasing, and related companies will benefit significantly. 1) In the complete machine segment, we recommend Mingyang Smart, Sany Heavy Energy, and Windey Co., with beneficiaries including Goldwind and Shanghai Electric Wind Power; 2) In the key components segment, we recommend Jinlei Technology, Orient Cable, and Titan Wind Energy, with beneficiaries including Tianshun Wind Energy, Dajin Heavy Industry, Haili Wind Power, and Riyue Co.

The price of onshore wind turbine units fluctuates widely, with significant price differences between different projects. According to information released by the China Public Tendering Service Platform, we have calculated that in December 2023, the average winning bid price for onshore wind turbine units (excluding tower tubes) was 1585 yuan/kW, a month-on-month increase of 13.16%; since January 2024, the average winning bid price for onshore wind turbine units (excluding tower tubes) has been 1327 yuan/kW, a month-on-month decrease of 16.32%. The main reason for the wide fluctuations in onshore wind turbine prices is the significant differences between projects, especially the relatively low average prices of the "Three North" large base projects.

The price of offshore wind turbine units has dropped significantly, with the lowest bid price falling below 2600 yuan/kW. According to information released by "Wind Energy," since January 2024, at least two offshore wind turbine projects have seen the lowest bid prices fall below 2600 yuan/kW, including: the 2024 Wind Turbine Framework Shortlist Centralized Procurement Project by China Power Construction (with a capacity of 3GW for the offshore wind project in package three, the lowest bid price was 7.35 billion yuan, equivalent to 2450 yuan/kW, opened on January 9, 2024), and the first phase of the 304MW offshore wind farm project on Yuetuo Island, Laoting, Tangshan by China Guodian (the lowest bid price was 2599.4 yuan/kW, opened on January 11, 2024).

The large-scale capacity of offshore wind turbine units is accelerating again, with single-unit capacity expected to reach 25MW. Recently, the Fujian Provincial Development and Reform Commission officially approved the national offshore wind power research and testing base project in the D and E areas off the coast of Changle. This project is located in the sea area east of Dongquan Island, Changle, and is being constructed by Fujian Huayi New Energy Technology Co., Ltd. The project includes the construction of 20 offshore wind test foundation platforms, including two 16MW units, three 18MW units, ten 20MW units, and five 25MW units, marking that China's 25MW offshore wind turbine units are now on the agenda.

Risk Warning: Downstream demand release is less than expected, intensified internal industry competition risk, wind turbine quality risk, upstream raw material price increase risk.

Investment_Strategy_Optimization.information: January 19, 2024, from a technical analysis perspective, after the stock index accelerated its decline at the end of October last year and hit a new low for the year, it once showed a stable and gradual upward trend. The stock index experienced a wave of technical rebound with oscillations, but due to multiple unsuccessful attempts to challenge the 60-day moving average, the stock index turned from strong to weak and showed a trend of oscillating decline, indicating that a round of oversold technical rebound had come to an end. At the beginning of the new year, the stock index continued its weak trend and accelerated its decline, with several major indices continuously falling and hitting new lows for the year, causing market confidence to be severely hit again. This week, the stock index continuously oscillated and adjusted. On Thursday, under the background of a general decline on Wednesday, the stock index accelerated its decline again and hit a new low for the year. The continuous sharp decline triggered a tentative entry of bottom-fishing funds from outside the market. The bulls, leveraging the heavyweight stocks, showed a trend of first suppressing and then rising. The significantly enlarged trading volume indicated a large divergence and fierce competition between the bulls and bears. The single needle bottoming out with increased volume on Thursday basically confirmed the short-term low point of the stock index, but we also need to see the shortcomings of Thursday, that is, although the stock index turned red and rose, the number of declining stocks still significantly exceeded the number of rising stocks, indicating that the rise on Thursday was still dominated by heavyweight stocks. Currently, the short- and medium-term moving averages have formed a divergent bearish arrangement after converging, still forming layers of resistance to the upward movement of the stock index. Although, as we expected, the stock index rebounded and rose on Thursday after continuously accelerating its decline, the overall weak characteristic of the market has not changed. Thursday's rise was more based on a technical rebound after the stock index was continuously oversold. Therefore, it is expected that short-term wide oscillations of the stock index may be unavoidable. Closely monitor the trends of the RMB exchange rate and the sentiment index, grasp the market rhythm, control positions, and select individual stocks for operation.

Investment_Strategy_Optimization.information: Quartz resource applications are trending towards high-end, making silica micropowder and high-purity quartz sand worth attention. Quartz is the raw material for almost all silicon-based materials, widely distributed in nature with diverse deposit types. Different raw ore grades and processing techniques lead to variations in downstream applications of quartz sand. Based on our main viewpoint in the "Silicon-Based Materials Research Framework" that "the core of new silicon-based materials lies in nanonization and high purification," and considering the preparation difficulty and downstream growth trends of various types of quartz sand/powder, we believe there are two new material categories worth attention: 1) silica micropowder, 2) high-purity quartz sand.

Investment_Strategy_Optimization.information: Insurance: Premiums under short-term pressure, expected continuous improvement in the medium to long term, optimistic outlook on the asset side. 1) The Financial Supervisory Authority disclosed the operating data of the insurance industry for November. The decline in life insurance has marginally narrowed, and auto insurance continues to grow rapidly. In November, the monthly premium of life insurance companies decreased by 0.5% year-on-year, with a significant narrowing of the decline; health insurance premiums decreased by 3.1% year-on-year; property insurance premiums increased by 5.9% year-on-year, with stable growth in auto insurance premiums and a rebound in the growth rate of non-auto insurance. By the end of November, the industry's investment asset scale reached 27.3 trillion yuan, an increase of 9% from the beginning of the year; bank deposits/bonds/stocks and funds/others (non-standard, etc.) accounted for 9.7%/44.6%/12.4%/33.3%, respectively. The proportion of stocks and funds remained basically flat compared to the beginning of the year, bonds increased by 3.7 percentage points, bank deposits decreased by 1.6 percentage points, and others (non-standard, etc.) decreased by 1.8 percentage points. 2) Some insurance companies are continuously lowering the settlement interest rates of universal insurance. According to media reports, some insurance companies have lowered the settlement interest rates of universal insurance from 4.5% to 4%, some companies have lowered it from 4% to 3.5%, and a few companies have lowered it to 3%. Lowering the settlement interest rate of universal insurance is an independent action by the industry to reduce liability costs based on market conditions. In the context of a downward trend in market interest rates, some insurance companies have chosen to lower the settlement interest rates of universal insurance to prevent interest rate spread risk. This will further improve the transmission mechanism between the investment side and the liability side of insurance companies, releasing more space for insurance companies to serve the real economy. 3) The insurance industry has significant pro-cyclical characteristics. In the future, with economic recovery, both the liability side and the investment side will significantly improve. As of January 12, 2024, the valuation of the insurance sector is 0.32-0.64 times 2023E P/EV, still at a historical low, maintaining an "outperform" rating.

Investment_Strategy_Optimization.information:
Currently, the driving factors for the price of onshore and offshore wind turbine units are mainly the large-scale capacity of the turbines, rather than the mere continuation of a "price war." The large-scale capacity of the units is an important way to reduce costs and increase efficiency for the entire machine, reflecting the technical competitiveness of the complete machine manufacturers. It also places higher demands on core components such as towers and main shafts, highlighting the competitive advantages of leading wind turbine and core component manufacturers. In addition, with the development of offshore wind power, the demand for large-megawatt units is gradually increasing, and related companies will benefit significantly. 1) In the complete machine segment, we recommend Mingyang Smart, Sany Heavy Energy, and Windey Co., with beneficiaries including Goldwind and Shanghai Electric Wind Power; 2) In the key components segment, we recommend Jinlei Technology, Orient Cable, and Titan Wind Energy, with beneficiaries including Titan Wind Energy, Dajin Heavy Industry, Haili Wind Power, and Riyue Heavy Industry.

The price of onshore wind turbine units fluctuates widely, with significant differences in turbine prices for different projects. According to information released by the China Public Tendering Service Platform, our statistics show that in December 2023, the average winning bid price for onshore wind turbine units (excluding tower tubes) was 1585 yuan/kW, a month-on-month increase of 13.16%; since January 2024, the average winning bid price for onshore wind turbines (excluding tower tubes) has been 1327 yuan/kW, a month-on-month decrease of 16.32%. The main reason for the wide fluctuations in onshore wind turbine prices is the significant differences between projects, especially the relatively low average prices of the "Three North" large base projects.

The price of offshore wind turbine units has dropped significantly, with the lowest bid price falling below 2600 yuan/kW. According to information released by "Wind Energy," since January 2024, at least two offshore wind turbine projects have seen the lowest bid prices fall below 2600 yuan/kW, including: the 2024 Wind Turbine Framework Shortlist Centralized Procurement Project by China Power Construction (with a capacity of 3GW for the offshore wind project in package three, the lowest bid price is 7.35 billion yuan, equivalent to 2450 yuan/kW, bid opening on January 9, 2024), and the first phase of the 304MW offshore wind farm project at Yuetuo Island, Laoting, Tangshan by Guodian (the lowest bid price is 2599.4 yuan/kW, bid opening on January 11, 2024).

The large-scale capacity of offshore wind turbine units is accelerating again, with single-unit capacity expected to reach 25MW. Recently, the Fujian Provincial Development and Reform Commission officially approved the national offshore wind power research and testing base project in the offshore areas D and E of Changle. This project is located in the sea area east of Dongquan Island, Changle, and is being constructed by Fujian Huayi New Energy Technology Co., Ltd. The project will build 20 offshore wind test foundation platforms, including two 16MW units, three 18MW units, ten 20MW units, and five 25MW units, marking that China's 25MW offshore wind turbine units are now on the agenda.

Risk Warning: Lower-than-expected downstream demand release, intensified internal industry competition, wind turbine quality risks, and upstream raw material price increase risks.

AI Terminals: AI PCs are ushering in a comprehensive explosion, and the implementation of generative AI applications will drive more intelligent terminal technology iterations. Lenovo, ASUS, Dell, HP, and other PC chips are all equipped with Intel Core Ultra processors, accelerating AI workloads and running many cloud-based AI applications. During the service process, you can ask the other party questions to obtain more information.
Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information:
The company's intelligent transportation system integration business includes two parts: highway intelligent transportation system integration and urban intelligent transportation system integration. Since its establishment, the company has focused on the field of intelligent transportation, extending from the initial highway intelligent transportation field to multi-field comprehensive services related to intelligent transportation. As a high-tech enterprise providing comprehensive intelligent transportation services, the company holds the "Highway Traffic Engineering (Highway Electromechanical Engineering) Professional Contracting First-Class Qualification" and "Highway Traffic Engineering (Highway Safety Facilities) Professional Contracting First-Class Qualification" issued by the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the "Excellent Level (CS4) in Information System Construction and Service Capability" issued by the China Electronic Information Industry Federation, and has passed multiple certifications including ISO9001 Quality Management System Certification, ISO14001 Environmental Management System Certification, and CMMI Maturity Level 3 Certification. The company belongs to the information transmission, software and information technology (I)-software and information technology service industry (I65)-information system integration service (I652)-information system integration service (I6520), and was listed on August 18, 2022. For financial assets or financial liabilities with active markets, the company determines their fair value based on quotations in active markets. For financial instruments without active markets, the company determines their fair value using valuation techniques.
When measuring non-financial assets at fair value, the ability of market participants to generate economic benefits by using the asset for its best use or by selling it to other market participants who can use it for its best use is considered.
The company uses valuation techniques that are applicable under current circumstances and supported by sufficient available data and other information, prioritizing relevant observable inputs, and only using unobservable inputs when observable inputs are not available or not feasible.
For assets and liabilities measured or disclosed at fair value in the financial statements, the fair value level to which they belong is determined based on the lowest level input that is significant to the overall fair value measurement: Level 1 inputs are unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets that are obtainable on the measurement date; Level 2 inputs are observable inputs for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly, other than Level 1 inputs; Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs for the asset or liability. The company has accumulated rich project experience in the field of intelligent transportation, with the scale of business bids often ranking at the forefront of the market. In recent years, with the promotion of intelligent transportation projects, the industry's comprehensive requirements for the technical strength, financial strength, and transportation construction experience of midstream integrators have significantly increased. In addition to traditional intelligent transportation system integrators, various types of enterprises have also rapidly entered this market segment. For example, upstream ICT (Information and Communication Technology) equipment giants and internet companies hope to extend their advantageous businesses backward, participating in market competition through joint bidding or even independent bidding to directly provide complete solutions for intelligent transportation systems; regional transportation investment groups or highway companies also hope to complete digital transformation and expand their business chains forward, setting up information technology subsidiaries to directly participate in related project construction; large state-owned enterprises such as communication operators and transportation construction units have also become highly competitive industry participants by leveraging their financial and specialized technical advantages. The intensification of industry competition may not only compress the profit margins of the business but also potentially eliminate companies in unfavorable competitive positions. Although the company currently has advantages in technology, experience, and talent over newer entrants, if the company cannot effectively respond to changes in industry development trends in terms of products and services, research and development, and market expansion, it may face the risk of weakened competitiveness and reduced market share, which could adversely affect the company's operating performance. In 2022, the national highway completed fixed asset investment of 2.9 trillion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 9.7%, with national transportation infrastructure investment moderately ahead. As of the end of 2022, the total mileage of highways in China reached 5.35 million kilometers, including 177,000 kilometers of expressways, indicating a broad market prospect for highway digital construction. In July 2022, the Central Political Bureau meeting emphasized maintaining the momentum of accelerating infrastructure investment and supporting local governments in using special bond funds to sustain high growth in infrastructure investment. Since 2021, the Ministry of Transport, in conjunction with relevant national ministries and commissions, has successively issued policy documents such as the "Outline of the Medium and Long-term Development Plan for Scientific and Technological Innovation in the Transportation Field (2021-2035)", the "Outline of the National Comprehensive Three-dimensional Transportation Network Plan", and the "14th Five-Year Plan for Digital Transportation Development", making the application scenarios of China's intelligent transportation market more extensive. Under the background of new infrastructure and accelerating the construction of a strong transportation country, the intelligent transportation industry is expected to grow steadily and rapidly.
In recent years, with the development of intelligent highway construction, the market size of China's intelligent highway transportation industry has been continuously expanding: the market size increased from 93.7 billion yuan in 2017 to 138.24 billion yuan in 2021, with a compound annual growth rate of 10.2%, and is expected to grow to 283.73 billion yuan in 2026, with a compound annual growth rate of 15.5%. Since 2019, China has canceled provincial toll stations on expressways, and the ETC electronic toll collection system has ushered in a wave of popularity, with intelligent highway transportation construction reaching a phased peak during the "13th Five-Year Plan" period. During the "14th Five-Year Plan" period, China will focus on increasing investment in the informatization and digitalization of transportation infrastructure, promoting the integration of new-generation information technologies such as cloud computing, big data, the Internet of Things, mobile internet, blockchain, and artificial intelligence with transportation, which will bring new growth opportunities for China's intelligent transportation construction.

There are many enterprises operating in the general-purpose engine parts industry in China, and the market is highly commercialized. As the market scale of the downstream complete machine manufacturing industry continues to expand, it will attract more competitors to enter. At the same time, production bases in Southeast Asia, South America, and other regions with cost advantages are gradually attracting the transfer of procurement orders from global complete machine manufacturers, making market competition more intense. Intense market competition may lead to a decline in industry product prices and profit margins. If the company's business development speed cannot keep up with the industry development level, the company's competitive advantage in the industry will be gradually weakened, thereby affecting the company's overall operating performance. Our company belongs to the machinery manufacturing industry. It mainly engages in the research and development, production, and sales of internal combustion engine crankshafts, compressor crankshafts, and related products. The company is a technology-driven high-tech enterprise, with all core products being independently developed. The company is recognized as a national high-tech enterprise and has successively won honors such as Suzhou Gazelle Plan Enterprise, Suzhou "Unicorn" Cultivation Enterprise, and Suzhou Specialized and New Demonstration Small and Medium-sized Enterprise. It has established provincial and municipal R&D institutions such as Jiangsu Province Intelligent Dispensing Robot Engineering Technology Research Center, Suzhou Municipal Enterprise Technology Center, and Suzhou Industrial Design Center. With high-quality products and excellent services, the company has established a good reputation and independent brand in the consumer electronics field, gaining high recognition from Apple Inc. and its EMS manufacturers and equipment integrators, and has established stable and deep cooperative relationships with them. Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information:
The company is a supplier focused on precision mechanical parts and high-level assembly in industries such as medical devices, scientific instruments, transportation, industrial equipment, and precision optics. It provides a one-stop service for new product development, small batch trial production, and large-scale manufacturing as a high-tech enterprise. The company's products are mainly used in fields with high precision requirements for core components, such as medical devices, scientific instruments, transportation, industrial equipment, and precision optics. The company specializes in precision mechanical parts for scientific instruments, medical devices, and transportation industries. Over years of development, it has accumulated management experience and numerous core technologies. In the field of scientific instruments, the company's products mainly include structural components for mass spectrometers and chromatographs. Currently, its largest customer in terms of service scale is Thermo Fisher, and it is also in contact with domestic companies in the scientific instrument field. In the field of medical devices, the company actively participates in the development of new products for its customers and has successfully developed products for well-known domestic medical companies such as Mindray, Yuying Medical, and Puaim Medical, with Mindray being one of the company's top five customers in 2022. In the field of transportation, the company possesses core technologies such as process concentration and composite tool innovation in the automotive industry and large-scale production, as well as machine tool automatic coordinate calculation technology. Its products have been supplied to globally renowned cabin interior manufacturers B/E Aerospace and globally renowned aircraft seat manufacturer RECARO. With the continuous increase in investment in product development, the continuous strengthening of technical capabilities, and the continuous improvement of product quality and stability, the company is expected to continuously enhance its brand influence, develop and expand new customers, and bring performance growth.

Active layout in the semiconductor business, promising future development in the semiconductor field
In 2021, the company built a thousand-level cleanroom and cleaning line and has the capability to produce related products in the semiconductor field. Currently, the company's semiconductor samples have met the product standards of customers such as Shanghai Microelectronics and Huahai Qingke, and the samples have passed the supplier standard review of semiconductor customers. The company's semiconductor business revenue in 2023 is not significant, but it will increase investment in research and development and production in the semiconductor field in the future, including equipment investment and talent investment, actively develop new customers, and strive to increase future semiconductor business revenue.

Profit forecast
It is forecasted that the company's revenue for 2023-2025 will be 218 million, 259 million, and 300 million yuan, respectively, with EPS of 0.43, 0.48, and 0.54 yuan, respectively. The current stock price corresponds to PEs of 85.0, 74.5, and 66.7 times, respectively. We believe that the company's layout in the semiconductor business is expected to bring new growth. We initiate coverage with an "Overweight" investment rating.

Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information:
Xingtai Nakonor Precision Rolling Technology Co., Ltd. was established in 2000, listed on the New Third Board in 2015, and went public on the Beijing Stock Exchange in 2023. Nakonor is a manufacturer of roll presses, primarily engaged in the research, development, production, and sales of roll presses for various new energy battery electrodes and other applications (such as polymer materials, carbon fiber, powder metallurgy, precious metal rolling, etc.). The advantages of the dry electrode process are evident and may become a new driving force for the company's future growth. The dry electrode manufacturing process can integrate mixing, slurry preparation, coating, drying, and rolling, simplifying the front-end process of electrode manufacturing. It does not require the use of toxic solvents such as NMP, reducing recovery costs and environmental pollution. Additionally, the dry electrode process benefits from smaller particle gaps, which will bring higher energy density to the batteries. Currently, the company's dry process-related technology has entered the pilot stage and is at the forefront domestically. If the dry electrode process becomes the mainstream technology route in the future, the dry roll press products are expected to open up new incremental space for the company.
The fundraising will increase capacity expansion, opening up future growth space. The company plans to implement the fundraising projects "Xingtai Phase II Plant Expansion Project" and "R&D Center and Headquarters Construction Project" to fully leverage existing technology and customer resources, break through the current capacity bottleneck, accelerate the release of orders on hand, and further increase the company's market share in the roll press industry. Additionally, the R&D center will strengthen the company's independent innovation capabilities, not only enhancing its competitiveness in the lithium battery manufacturing equipment field but also extending into new fields such as fuel cells, carbon fiber, multi-material composites, and new material forming.

Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information:
The company expects to achieve revenue of 570-600 million yuan in the first three quarters of 2023, with a year-on-year growth of 23%-27%. Among this, the third quarter is expected to achieve revenue of 230-250 million yuan, with a year-on-year growth of 20%-30% and a quarter-on-quarter growth of 18%-28%. The net profit attributable to the parent company is expected to grow in both the third quarter and the first three quarters. In 2022, the company achieved revenue and net profit attributable to the parent company of 670 million yuan and 130 million yuan respectively, with a CAGR of 30% and 85% from 2019 to 2022. The company's revenue has been growing steadily, mainly due to the mass production of thermal runaway protection insulation parts for new energy vehicles. The company's automotive safety parts business achieved revenue of 470 million yuan in 2022, with a CAGR of 82% from 2019 to 2022. The profit growth rate is higher than the revenue growth rate, benefiting from the continuous increase in the proportion of new energy vehicle products with better profitability and the scale effect brought by the growth of the company's revenue size.
Multi-dimensional efforts to build a moat, ensuring the company's medium and long-term development
The company's main business is various high-temperature resistant insulation mica products, mainly used in thermal runaway protection insulation parts for new energy vehicles, flame-retardant insulation parts for small household appliances, flame-retardant insulation tapes for cables, etc. The automotive safety parts business accounted for 70% of the company's revenue in 2022, making it the largest source of revenue for the company. Since its establishment in 1998, the company has been deeply involved in the mica materials industry, forming a wide moat in terms of technology, customers, and management, and is expected to maintain a high market share. In terms of technology, the company has pioneered an integrated molding process for mica materials in the field of new energy vehicles, breaking through the shape limitations of original mica products and expanding from two-dimensional structures to three-dimensional structures. This gives thermal runaway protection insulation parts for new energy vehicles better mechanical strength, weather resistance, and fire insulation performance. In terms of customers, the company has deep cooperation with globally renowned automotive brands such as Tesla, Volkswagen, BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Volvo, as well as leading global battery companies such as CATL, Farasis Energy, Northvolt, and SKn, ensuring excellent customer quality. In terms of management, the company's actual controller and core management team have long been engaged in high-temperature resistant insulation mica materials, with a deep understanding of industry trends, and have formed effective management methods in product quality control and supply chain management.
Structural innovation enhances thermal management demands, driving mica material demand
Mica materials have excellent chemical stability, heat resistance, mechanical properties, and electrical properties, and are widely used in construction, automotive, power, industrial, household appliances, and other industries. The new energy vehicle and energy storage industries have developed rapidly in recent years, becoming emerging application fields for mica materials. The structural innovation of new energy vehicle power batteries has accelerated in recent years. CATL's Kirin battery and SVOLT's Dragon Scale Armor battery both optimize battery safety performance from the source of thermal runaway in the battery system. As a leading enterprise in thermal runaway protection insulation parts, the company's related products are expected to gain more applications. According to Frost & Sullivan, the global mica materials market for new energy vehicles is expected to reach 10.44 billion yuan by 2027, with a CAGR of 43% from 2022 to 2027. The global mica materials market for energy storage is expected to reach 1.92 billion yuan by 2027, with a CAGR of 71% from 2022 to 2027, providing a broad market space. In addition, the company is actively expanding application scenarios such as commercial vehicles, which is expected to further open up growth potential.

Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information: The company's main business is the research and development, production, and sales of various high-temperature resistant insulating mica products. After years of technological innovation, product development, and market expansion, the company has accumulated extensive customer resources in downstream application industries such as new energy vehicles, small household appliances, and wires and cables. The products have passed standards such as UL, FDA, TÜV, and EU RoHS, PAHs, and REACH. The new energy vehicle industry is an emerging field for the application of high-temperature resistant insulating mica materials. As a leading enterprise that entered this field early, the company closely aligns with industry needs and has independently innovated in material formulations, product design, and manufacturing processes. The products have strong competitive advantages and are widely used in the thermal runaway protection systems of battery cells, battery modules, battery packs, and complete vehicles of globally renowned new energy vehicle brands. The company's main customers include Tesla, Volkswagen, BMW, Mercedes-Benz, Volvo, SAIC Group, FAW Group, and other globally or domestically renowned automobile manufacturers, as well as the global leading power battery company CATL. The downstream markets for the company's various high-temperature resistant insulating mica products involve new energy vehicles, wires and cables, household appliances, and other fields, closely linked to the macroeconomic development situation. Currently, the domestic macroeconomic development is generally stable and improving, with the domestic economy maintaining stable growth. The downstream industries of the company are developing well, with broad market prospects, and the company's business is in a stage of steady growth. If there are significant fluctuations in the domestic macroeconomic situation in the future, and the scale of the aforementioned downstream markets does not meet expectations, resulting in market demand fluctuations, it will adversely affect the company's operating performance. According to the "National Economic Industry Classification" (GB/T 4754-2017) published by the National Bureau of Statistics, the industry in which the company operates belongs to "C30 Non-metallic Mineral Manufacturing" under "C3082 Mica Products Manufacturing."

Since 2012, the company has been continuously rated as a high-tech enterprise, received the Shanghai Science and Technology Little Giant honor in 2015, and was awarded the title of "Little Giant" enterprise by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology in 2022.

The company is a platform company specializing in the R&D design, production, manufacturing, and operation services of smart hardware products, belonging to the smart hardware ODM industry. It mainly serves well-known smart hardware brand manufacturers and internet companies at home and abroad, such as Samsung, OPPO, Xiaomi, vivo, Amazon, Lenovo, LG, Acer, ASUS, Sony, etc. The company's product line covers smart phones, laptops, tablets, smart wearables (including smart watches, TWS earphones, smart bracelets, etc.), AIoT products (including smart POS machines, automotive electronics, smart speakers, etc.), and servers and other smart hardware products. The company has been deeply involved in the smart hardware ODM industry for more than ten years, relying on its own R&D design, system software development, engineering testing, supply chain resource integration, production manufacturing, and quality management capabilities, seizing the development opportunities of the global electronic information industry's specialized division of labor, and the era of smart hardware becoming an important data traffic and service entry point for the era of the Internet of Everything. It is committed to building a multi-category smart hardware platform centered on smart phones, with laptops, tablets, smart wearables, AIoT products, and servers developing symbiotically. Currently, the company has developed into a large-scale technology R&D and manufacturing enterprise with advanced smart hardware R&D and manufacturing capabilities and ecological platform construction capabilities, and holds a leading market share and unique industrial chain position in the global consumer electronics ODM field. The company is a platform company specializing in the R&D design, production, manufacturing, and operation services of smart hardware products. During the reporting period, the company continuously explored the core sub-fields of smart hardware products. The smart hardware products developed, designed, produced, manufactured, and operated by the company mainly serve the consumer electronics mobile phone and personal home digital terminal industry market, the laptop industry market, the data server industry market, the automotive electronics industry market, and other fields. Since 2022, affected by multiple factors such as the global macro economy, international environment, and weakened consumer confidence, global consumer electronics demand has been relatively weak, and the consumer electronics industry continued to be under pressure in the first half of 2023. However, with the continuous development of communication technology, the continuous popularization of 4G/5G networks, and the development of AI technology, the demand for computing power on mobile phones will gradually increase, driving the innovation and iteration of consumer electronics products, cultivating new growth points for consumer electronics products, and the future demand for the consumer electronics industry is expected to recover steadily. According to IDC forecast data, global shipments of smart phones and wearable smart products are expected to resume growth by 2024, reaching 1.782 billion units, and 1.862 billion units by 2025. With AIoT as the representative of general smart terminals, with the support of artificial intelligence and big data, it will also develop incrementally, and the penetration rate of ODM in this field will continue to increase, requiring the construction of a collaborative development trend of the hardware ecosystem. In the future, there will be a relatively large incremental and vigorous development trend.
The company is a platform company specializing in the R&D design, production, manufacturing, and operation services of smart hardware products, mainly serving well-known smart hardware brand manufacturers and internet companies at home and abroad. The company closely follows the market and business trends of smart hardware products, seizes the development opportunities of the global electronic manufacturing industry's specialized division of labor, and has laid a solid foundation in the fields of smart phones, tablets, and laptops. During the reporting period, the company continued to focus on the smart hardware industry. The product lines of each business of the company cover smart phones, laptops, tablets, smart wearables (including smart watches, TWS earphones, smart bracelets, etc.), AIoT products (including smart POS machines, automotive electronics, smart speakers, etc.), and servers and other smart hardware products.

Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information:
CITIC Metal is an important subsidiary of CITIC Group's advanced materials sector and a leading domestic trader of metals and mineral products, possessing multiple world-class mining assets globally. The company mainly engages in the trade of bulk commodities in metals and minerals and mining investment business. The traded commodities primarily include ferrous metal products such as iron ore and steel, non-ferrous metal products such as copper, niobium, and aluminum, as well as other trading products. The overseas first-class mining assets invested in include Brazil Mining and Metallurgy Company, Peru's Bambas Copper Mine, and Ivanhoe Mines. The high-quality domestic assets invested in include Western Superconducting Technologies and Zhongbo Shijin. In 2022, the company's operating income was 119.2 billion yuan. According to the "2022 China Top 500 Enterprises" list released by the China Enterprise Confederation and the China Enterprise Directors Association, it can be ranked 215th (CITIC Metal does not participate in the ranking separately, and the data is consolidated into CITIC Group for ranking).

CITIC Metal actively builds a global supply chain service network, vigorously develops the trade of bulk commodities in metals and minerals, relies on upstream resource advantages, fully leverages the promotion role of copper and niobium mine investments in bulk commodity trade, and makes positive contributions to ensuring the security of the national metal and mineral supply chain and industrial chain. Currently, China's economic operation faces new complex challenges from both international and domestic fronts. Internationally, the geopolitical landscape is undergoing profound adjustments, the external environment is complex and severe, economic growth remains sluggish, supply chain and industrial chain are under impact, international trade and investment are slowing down, global inflation is high, the tightening effects of central bank policies in developed countries are emerging, international trade and investment are slowing down, international market demand is weakening, external demand continues to weaken, and risks in the global economic and financial fields are accumulating. Domestically, the current improvement in China's economic operation is mainly restorative, endogenous motivation is still not strong, demand is still insufficient, and economic transformation and upgrading face new resistance. However, overall, China's development foundation is solid, market potential is huge, policy effects are emerging, and the long-term positive fundamentals of the economy have not changed.

In terms of bulk commodity trade, influenced by factors such as the Russia-Ukraine conflict, US dollar interest rate hikes, insufficient demand, and the coexistence of high interest rates and economic slowdown, global bulk commodity prices have fluctuated significantly, with an overall downward trend. Meanwhile, domestic industries such as real estate and infrastructure still have weak demand for bulk commodities, metal and mineral prices, especially ferrous metals like steel, have declined, and the growth rate of demand for non-ferrous metals still has some uncertainties. In the first half of the year, the US dollar to RMB exchange rate fluctuated significantly in the range of 6.71-7.23. At the beginning of the year, the RMB exchange rate against the US dollar once appreciated to 6.7099. Subsequently, the continuous interest rate hikes by the Federal Reserve, changes in the Russia-Ukraine situation, and other factors pushed up the US dollar index. Coupled with the domestic economic recovery falling short of expectations, the RMB exchange rate fluctuated widely and weakened, returning to around 7.2.

Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information: The company is a manufacturer of automotive sports parts with sunroofs as its main product. It possesses the integrated capabilities of designing, developing, and producing automotive sunroofs, primarily serving well-known domestic and international automobile manufacturers established in China, as well as some overseas vehicle manufacturers. It provides professional and systematic complete solutions for various automotive sunroofs and other automotive sports parts, making it an excellent Tier 1 supplier of automotive components. The company's main customers currently include well-known domestic vehicle manufacturers such as Changan Automobile, FAW Group, Geely Automobile, GAC Group, SAIC Volkswagen, and Great Wall Motors. Since Webasto invented the first folding roof in 1932, the domestic and international automotive sunroof market has been monopolized by foreign sunroof giants. Since its establishment, the company has been deeply involved in the automotive sunroof field, with nearly 20 years of relentless effort. Guided by relevant national industrial policies, it has fully leveraged its advantages in R&D, customer relations, processes, quality, services, and talent. Market-oriented and efficiency-centered, relying on technological progress, it has continuously grown and gradually broken the monopoly of the domestic sunroof market by foreign capital. In 2023, Yutian Guanji's automotive sunroof sales reached 2.311 million units. According to the "Global and China Automotive Sunroof Industry Independent Market Research" report issued by Toubao Research Institute, Yutian Guanji became the second-largest supplier in the Chinese automotive sunroof market in 2023, with a market share of 16%. It is also the only automotive sunroof company among the top five suppliers in the Chinese sunroof market as of 2022 that originated in China. It is precisely Yutian Guanji's two decades of dedication to the automotive sunroof industry that has gradually broken the monopoly of foreign companies in the automotive sunroof industry, giving Chinese companies a place in the competitive automotive sunroof market. In the future, Yutian Guanji will continue to increase R&D investment, strengthen technological innovation, improve management systems and operational mechanisms, and, based on the Chinese market, strive to enhance the company's market share in China while continuously expanding overseas markets, aiming to become a world-renowned automotive sunroof supplier. The company's main products include panoramic sunroofs and small sunroofs. Among them, panoramic sunroofs are divided into top-mounted panoramic sunroofs and bottom-mounted panoramic sunroofs. Top-mounted panoramic sunroofs are products that are assembled onto the vehicle's roof from the outside, while bottom-mounted panoramic sunroofs are products that are assembled onto the vehicle's roof from the interior.

Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information:
Huangshan Valley Jie is a national high-tech enterprise specializing in the research, development, production, and sales of power semiconductor module heat dissipation substrates. It is a leading company in the automotive-grade power semiconductor module heat dissipation substrate industry. The company's products are mainly used in the field of new energy vehicles and are an important component of power semiconductor modules for new energy vehicle motor controllers. At the same time, the company's products also have broad application prospects in the fields of new energy power generation and energy storage.

Since its establishment, the company has been deeply engaged in the field of automotive-grade power semiconductor module heat dissipation substrates. With innovative cold precision forging process applications, excellent mold design and manufacturing capabilities, and superior automotive-grade product quality, it has accumulated a good market reputation and gained recognition from high-quality customers in the industry. Currently, the company is the largest supplier of power semiconductor module heat dissipation substrates for Infineon's new energy vehicle motor controllers, a global leader in power semiconductors. It has also established long-term stable cooperative relationships with well-known power semiconductor manufacturers at home and abroad, such as Bosch, ON Semiconductor, Hitachi, STMicroelectronics, CRRC Times, StarPower Semiconductor, Silan Microelectronics, and Chiplink. The company's market position and product quality are both at the industry-leading level.

The company indirectly provides component support for new energy vehicles through downstream automotive-grade power module manufacturers, and its products are widely used in major mainstream new energy vehicle brands. The company actively responds to the national development plan for strategic emerging industries and has long been committed to the development of the new energy vehicle industry. It continuously conducts research and development on automotive-grade power semiconductor module heat dissipation substrates. The company actively researches new technologies and processes to address the inherent defects of traditional technology processes, such as complexity and high manufacturing costs. It innovatively uses cold precision forging technology to produce copper pin-type heat dissipation substrates. The raw material copper blanks are integrally forged using cold precision forging technology, directly forming the pin-fin precision structure that previously required complex processes to complete.

The application of cold precision forging technology to produce copper pin-type heat dissipation substrates is a brand-new technological innovation, and all mold designs are independently completed by the company. Through long-term experience accumulation and experimental exploration, the company systematically summarizes the deformation rules and weak points of mold design, overcoming difficulties such as material shortage during forming, deformation during demolding, and limited mold life in the cold precision forging process. This cold precision forging process is simple and efficient, significantly improving production efficiency and reducing production costs while enhancing product quality. Compared with traditional technology, it has obvious advantages and is at the industry-leading level. It has been unanimously recognized by well-known power semiconductor manufacturers at home and abroad, including Infineon.

In recent years, the company's core competitiveness and market recognition have steadily improved. It has been selected as an Anhui Province Specialized and New Champion Enterprise, Anhui Province New Energy Vehicle and Intelligent Connected Vehicle Industry Advantage Enterprise (first batch), the fifth batch of national-level Specialized and New "Little Giant" Enterprises, Anhui Province Technology Innovation Demonstration Enterprise, and has been recognized by the Anhui Province Enterprise Technology Center. It has also won the Infineon 2023 Best Power Module Supplier, CRRC Times Best Strategic Cooperation Award, Excellence Quality Award, Silan Microelectronics Annual Excellent Strategic Supplier, and Chiplink Annual Excellent Supplier. The company regards product quality and technological innovation as fundamental, continuously improving its quality control system, and has formed a series of core technologies for heat dissipation substrate production, including cold forging integrated forming technology, mold design, development, and manufacturing technology. As of the signing date of this prospectus, the company holds 10 invention patents and 12 utility model patents.

Newshare_Evaluation_Reporting.information: The company is a global provider of comprehensive 3D vision digitalization solutions, with its main business being the research and development, production, and sales of 3D vision digitalization products and systems. The company has been deeply involved in the professional field of 3D vision digitalization software and hardware for many years, gradually accumulating rich technical capabilities in key optical components, core 3D vision algorithms, high-performance hardware structure design, 3D analysis and measurement comparison software, and other major aspects. It has built a relatively complete 3D vision digitalization technology platform and continuously developed innovative products with wide applicability and strong versatility based on this. Currently, the company's products mainly cover two differentiated tracks: industrial-grade high precision and professional-grade high cost performance, including portable 3D vision digitalization products, tracking 3D vision digitalization products, professional-grade color 3D vision digitalization products, and industrial-grade automated 3D vision inspection systems. The company's products are widely used in industrial application fields such as aerospace, automotive manufacturing, engineering machinery, transportation, 3C electronics, green energy, as well as in the digitalization of everything in fields such as teaching and research, 3D printing, art and cultural heritage, medical health, public security and justice, and virtual worlds. The company is committed to providing high-precision, high-portability, and intelligent 3D vision digitalization system solutions, creating a globally leading 3D vision digitalization national brand. Since its establishment, the company has actively responded to the national strategies of "strengthening the chain, solving bottlenecks" and building a strong manufacturing and technological nation, focusing on creating optical 3D digitalization inspection products and supporting systems for mid-to-high-end manufacturing, helping the country's manufacturing industry "fill gaps" and "cover blanks." The handheld 3D laser scanner is an innovative technology application in the 3D vision digitalization industry, especially in the field of precision measurement. It can accurately, efficiently, and massively obtain 3D data of scanned objects, which is a breakthrough in innovative technical means compared to traditional methods. For many years, domestic high-precision industrial 3D digitalization scanning equipment mainly relied on imports, and industries such as national defense and aerospace were easily restricted by foreign companies. In 2015, the company launched the self-developed handheld 3D digitalization laser scanner HSCAN series, breaking the monopoly of portable laser 3D digitalization scanning equipment by foreign companies. The company is a fourth batch national-level specialized and new "Little Giant" enterprise, a high-tech enterprise, a Zhejiang Province intellectual property demonstration enterprise, and a high-tech enterprise research and development center, and won the second prize of the 2022 Mechanical Industry Science and Technology Progress Award. Since its establishment, the company has been deeply involved in the field of 3D vision digitalization, forming three core technology clusters in independent technology reserves, including 3D recognition and reconstruction technology, 3D stereoscopic extension technology, and stereoscopic vision calibration technology. It has mastered and broken through 18 core technologies, including rapid high-precision edge computing technology, tracking range expansion technology, multi-line laser technology, hole measurement technology, automated 3D scanning technology, built-in photogrammetry composite scanning technology, and multi-band scanning technology, building a strong technical moat for the company's product matrix. The company's core technologies, represented by rapid high-precision edge computing technology, tracking range expansion technology, multi-line laser technology, and hole measurement technology, lead the industry's technological progress. The company's core technology-related patents, represented by multi-band scanning technology, multi-band calibration technology, and built-in photogrammetry composite scanning technology, have been granted invention patents in multiple countries worldwide. As of April 30, 2023, the company has 50 domestic authorized invention patents and 11 foreign authorized invention patents (including the United States, Europe, and South Korea). The company has a high reputation and good market reputation in the industry. During the reporting period, the company has served thousands of terminal customers, with distributors and sales and technical support teams spread across major countries and regions, providing industry-leading 3D digitalization technology solutions to well-known enterprises such as COMAC, Terminal Customer A, Terminal Customer B, Terminal Customer C, CATL, ZTE, Apple, BMW, BYD, Tesla, FAW-Volkswagen, SAIC Volkswagen, SAIC General Motors, Brilliance BMW, NIO, Foton Motor, Chery Automobile, Zoomlion, XCMG, Liugong Machinery, Sany Marine, as well as research institutions such as the Space Application Engineering and Technology Center of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, the China Aerospace Aerodynamics Research Institute, the Institute of Microelectronics of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, the Shanghai Aerospace Precision Machinery Research Institute, the Beijing Great Wall Aviation Measurement and Control Technology Research Institute of AVIC, Tsinghua University, Zhejiang University, Xiamen University, and Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics. The company has cooperated with the Space Application Engineering and Technology Center of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, with related products applied in the "China Space Station" on-orbit experiment, and cooperated with Shanghai Aircraft Manufacturing Co., Ltd. under COMAC, with related products applied in the "C919 large aircraft" project, both receiving high praise from customers. 3D vision digitalization products can be divided into high-precision industrial-grade fields, high-efficiency professional-grade fields, and high-cost-performance commercial-grade application fields according to the different precision requirements of downstream application scenarios and different scanning and inspection implementation methods. In the future of digitalization of everything, with the continuous development of downstream application fields of 3D digitalization product systems, including industrial-grade, professional-grade, and commercial-grade, the application scenarios of 3D vision digitalization products in emerging fields such as intelligent manufacturing, virtual worlds, digital twins, artificial intelligence AI, 3D printing, Internet of Things IoT, and personalized customization are continuously expanding and extending. According to the "China and Global 3D Vision Digitalization Products Market Research Report," the global 3D digitalization products market sales revenue will increase from approximately 50.06 billion yuan in 2022 to 120.32 billion yuan in 2027. According to the calculations of the China Instrument and Control Society, in the industrial-grade field, the company's main product, the handheld laser 3D scanner, ranked first in the domestic market share in 2021. The company is actively building localized teams in Europe and the United States and other places. In 2022, the company's overseas market sales were 66.8121 million yuan, and its products were exported to major countries and regions worldwide. Expanding the overseas market as one of the most important development strategic directions for the company in the next five years will introduce strong driving force for the company's performance growth.

The company has published 13 professional papers in the journal of the International Society for Optical Engineering (SPIE). With comprehensive advantages in technology, brand, and products, the company's products are exported to more than 60 countries worldwide, earning a good market reputation. It has established cooperative relationships with well-known domestic and foreign manufacturers, research institutes, and universities, including CETC, Company A, Han's Laser, CAS, CAEP, Unit B, and others, making it a globally renowned laser supplier. The company leads the "High-Performance High-Power Picosecond Laser for Manufacturing" project, a key special project of the "14th Five-Year Plan" national key research and development program "Additive Manufacturing and Laser Manufacturing," and has undertaken sub-projects of the national "863 Program" and other major national science and technology projects. Since participating in the "Technology Olympics" laser display project of the Beijing Olympics in 2008, the company has continued to undertake or participate in various national and provincial-level technological innovation projects, including the "13th Five-Year Plan" national key research and development program "Additive Manufacturing and Laser Manufacturing" key special topics, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology's rare earth optoelectronic functional materials and devices development and engineering project, the Ministry of Science and Technology's high-power fiber-coupled semiconductor laser pump source development and industrialization project, Beijing's major innovation achievements transformation project of the high-precision industry development fund, Beijing's frontier new material technology innovation (bottleneck) special sub-project, and sub-projects under the national major project—high-end scientific instrument industry chain project, among other technological innovation work in the field of lasers and materials.

It specializes in providing integrated solutions for photovoltaic module junction box products and has been publicly recognized as a national-level specialized and innovative "Little Giant" enterprise. Since its establishment, the company has consistently followed the global technological development path of solar photovoltaic modules. Through continuous technological innovation and product development, it is committed to providing safe, reliable, efficient, and intelligent photovoltaic module junction box series products for downstream industries and customers. Adhering to the concept of technology-driven and market-oriented, the company has established a prominent industry position and brand image in the domestic and international photovoltaic module junction box field through years of technological accumulation. By the end of the reporting period, it had developed 62 independent research and development patents, including 10 invention patents. The company participated in the formulation of the national standard GB/T 37410-2019 "Technical Conditions for Junction Boxes of Solar Photovoltaic Modules for Ground Use" and serves as a member unit of the China Photovoltaic Industry Association, a director unit of the Asia Photovoltaic Industry Association, and a director unit of the Jiangsu Photovoltaic Industry Association. The company's Z8X product is the world's first photovoltaic module junction box to obtain TUV Rheinland 35A certification, the ZS product is the first intelligent junction box product in mainland China to pass TUV Rheinland certification, the Z8S product is the first three-part intelligent junction box in mainland China to obtain TUV Rheinland certification, and the Z8C product won the "Solar Energy Cup" 2021 annual single product award and the 2022 "Quality Wins China" photovoltaic component junction box excellence award, and was shortlisted in the top photovoltaic product list in the United States. Leveraging its comprehensive advantages in design and development, quality control, and service response, the company has established good cooperative relationships with internationally renowned photovoltaic module companies such as Customer A, Maxeon, Customer B, Customer C, Sonnenkraft, and leading domestic photovoltaic module manufacturers such as TCL Zhonghuan, JinkoSolar, Suntech Power, Eging Photovoltaic, Runyang Co., Seraphim, Haitai New Energy, and Zhongqing Photovoltaic. The final products are widely used in solar photovoltaic power stations at home and abroad. Utilizing its technological reserves in the field of photovoltaic module junction boxes, the company has accelerated its technological layout for auxiliary power battery boxes for new energy vehicles in recent years. The company has signed a strategic cooperation agreement with Camel Group, becoming an important supplier of auxiliary power battery boxes for its new energy vehicles. Through Camel Group, it supplies auxiliary power battery boxes for new energy vehicles to several automakers, including BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and XPeng. The auxiliary power battery box for XPeng models has been mass-produced and supplied to Camel Group, the BMW model project is in the design verification stage, and the auxiliary power battery box for the Mercedes-Benz model project has entered the process development stage. The auxiliary power battery box business for new energy vehicles is expected to become a new growth point for the company in the future.
