Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information: The functional carbon-based materials industry has relatively high technical requirements. Companies in the industry must continuously invest in R&D and constantly develop new technologies and products to effectively meet the production needs of downstream customers and maintain market competitiveness. In the future, if the issuer's new products and new technology R&D fail, or if competitors achieve technological breakthroughs first and launch products with more advanced processes, better performance, lower costs, and greater competitiveness, it will affect the issuer's market competitiveness, thereby leading to a decline in profitability. The development of new technologies and new products relies on an excellent and stable technical R&D team. With the development of the issuer's business and the implementation of the R&D center construction project, the issuer's demand for high-quality technical R&D personnel will further increase. If effective measures are not taken to ensure the stability of core technical personnel and to motivate technical R&D personnel, it may lead to the loss of core technical personnel and even the leakage of core technologies, which will adversely affect the issuer's ability to maintain core competitiveness. During each reporting period, the issuer's operating income was 136.0177 million yuan, 303.0129 million yuan, 438.6469 million yuan, and 260.1545 million yuan, respectively, with a compound growth rate of 79.58% from 2020 to 2022, indicating a rapid growth rate. During the reporting period, the issuer's products were mainly applied in the photovoltaic crystalline silicon manufacturing field, and the performance growth was mainly due to the rapid development of the photovoltaic industry. During each reporting period, the revenue proportions of the company's top five customers (calculated on a consolidated basis under the same control) were 74.32%, 51.12%, 49.20%, and 46.42%, respectively, indicating a high customer concentration. The company's products are currently mainly applied in the photovoltaic crystalline silicon manufacturing field, and the high customer concentration is mainly due to the high concentration in the downstream photovoltaic crystalline silicon manufacturing industry. During each reporting period, the proportion of the company's procurement amount from the top five raw material and outsourced processing suppliers to the total procurement amount of raw materials and outsourced processing was 84.99%, 81.91%, 60.42%, and 63.41%, respectively, indicating a relatively concentrated supplier base. In the future, if the company's cooperation with major suppliers undergoes adverse changes, and the stability, timeliness, and price levels of raw material supply cannot be guaranteed, it will adversely affect the company's production and operations. As of the signing date of this prospectus, the issuer has leased properties that have not been registered for lease filing, and some leased properties have not obtained property ownership certificates. In future business operations, if the issuer incurs additional expenses due to the aforementioned unregistered lease filings, property ownership defects, or the lessor's lack of authority to lease the relevant properties, resulting in abnormal termination of leases, inability to renew leases, or relocation, it may have a certain degree of adverse impact on the issuer and its subsidiaries' business and financial conditions.

The issuer's controlling shareholder and actual controller, Mr. Deng Kefei, directly holds 83.81% of the issuer's shares before this issuance and will still control more than two-thirds of the issuer's voting rights after this issuance, maintaining an absolute controlling position with the ability to exert significant influence on the issuer's major business and financial decisions. If Mr. Deng Kefei uses his position as the actual controller and his influence on the issuer to improperly control major issues such as the issuer's business management and external investments through exercising voting rights, it may harm the interests of the issuer and other shareholders. After the implementation of the fundraising investment projects, the company's fixed asset scale will increase significantly, and the asset structure will undergo substantial changes. The company will increase the original value of fixed assets by 672.8877 million yuan, accounting for 76.89% of the total investment, which will lead to a significant increase in fixed asset depreciation, adversely affecting the company's net profit. If future market demand changes, the increased depreciation brought by fixed asset investment will put pressure on the company's future performance. During the reporting period, the company's main raw materials were power modules, electrical components, housings, steel, copper, silicon steel sheets, etc., with the risk of raw material price increases. The company's key raw material is the IGBT in power modules, with procurement amounts during the reporting period of 40.6887 million yuan, 32.3517 million yuan, 69.2838 million yuan, and 41.6692 million yuan, accounting for 13.74%, 8.00%, 10.29%, and 13.18% of the total raw material procurement, respectively. IGBT is a core component of energy conversion and transmission. The IGBT brands currently used by the company mainly include Switzerland's ABB, Germany's Infineon, and Zhuzhou CRRC. During the reporting period, the proportion of foreign brands in the company's IGBT procurement was 58.44%, 78.61%, 75.92%, and 35.31%, respectively. If international trade frictions continue to escalate or other bilateral trade frictions occur, and the aforementioned countries prohibit or restrict relevant manufacturers from supplying IGBT products to China, it will adversely affect the stability and cost of the company's raw material supply. The main products produced and sold by the company are integrated variable frequency drives, special frequency converters, special motors, electrical control, and power supply products. The company takes the integrated variable frequency drive as its core product, with sales revenue of integrated variable frequency drives accounting for the highest proportion of main business income during the reporting period, at 56.95%, 64.49%, 51.95%, and 62.68%, respectively. Currently, the company is one of the few domestic companies capable of designing and producing integrated variable frequency drives. However, as other domestic manufacturers successfully develop and produce integrated variable frequency drives, industry competition will intensify, which may lead to a decline in the company's profitability.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
The company mainly engages in the research and development, production, and sales of hydraulic components and parts, with products primarily used in industries such as construction machinery. The development of the aforementioned industries is significantly influenced by changes in national and even global macroeconomic conditions and industrial structure adjustments, and is highly sensitive to economic prosperity. Therefore, the hydraulic industry is prone to cyclical fluctuations due to macroeconomic cycles. When the macroeconomy is in an upward cycle, there is usually strong demand for fixed asset investment and significant expansion in investment scale, leading to rapid development in downstream industries such as construction machinery, which in turn drives the rapid development of the hydraulic industry. Conversely, when the macroeconomy is in a downward cycle, if the demand for fixed asset investment is sluggish and the market scale shrinks, the development of downstream industries such as construction machinery faces pressure, and the development of the hydraulic industry also slows down accordingly. Therefore, the industry in which the company operates is subject to the risk of being affected by macroeconomic cyclical fluctuations. 

Domestic hydraulic enterprises in China are characterized by a large number of companies, generally small scale, relatively weak financial strength, slightly insufficient technical strength, and overall weak competitiveness, with a certain gap compared to international leading hydraulic enterprises. Currently, the company may face the risk of intensified market competition in the future. On one hand, if international leading hydraulic enterprises increase their efforts to expand in the Chinese market, it will put significant pressure on the market space of domestic brands; on the other hand, if other domestic competitors increase their research and development and production efforts, or if new entrants from upstream and downstream industries participate in the hydraulic components industry, it will lead to intensified competition within the industry, which may squeeze the market share of the company's products, potentially leading to a decline in the company's market share and profit levels.

From 2020 to 2021, benefiting from strong demand in downstream industries such as construction machinery and the company's increased market expansion efforts, the company's operating income was 700.2315 million yuan and 842.3492 million yuan respectively, and the net profit attributable to shareholders of the parent company after deducting non-recurring gains and losses was 133.4831 million yuan and 148.0052 million yuan respectively, with both operating income and net profit maintaining growth in each period. In 2022, due to factors such as the slowdown in demand in domestic downstream industries such as construction machinery, the company's operating income was 706.7063 million yuan, and the net profit attributable to shareholders of the parent company after deducting non-recurring gains and losses was 140.9809 million yuan. In the future, if there is a decline in the macroeconomic and downstream industries such as construction machinery, intensified market competition, a significant increase in the prices of the company's main raw materials, and failure to timely expand the downstream customer market, and if the company fails to respond in a timely manner, it will affect the company's production and operation, and there is a risk of a decline in the company's operating performance.

From 2020 to 2022, the sales revenue from the company's top five customers accounted for 75.24%, 73.02%, and 75.05% of the operating income for the respective periods. The company's main products include oil tanks, hard pipes, and metal fittings, mainly used in fields such as construction machinery, with major customers including large original equipment manufacturers in the construction machinery industry such as Caterpillar, Volvo, Komatsu, XCMG Group, Liugong Group, and Kobelco Construction Machinery. In the future, if the cooperative relationship with major customers deteriorates, customers increase their procurement from other suppliers, or if the operating performance of major customers declines significantly, reducing procurement volume, it will adversely affect the company's operating performance.

In addition, if the market prices of major raw materials increase significantly, it will also adversely affect the company's product gross profit margin. The development of the LED and semiconductor packaging and testing equipment industry is not only affected by its own industrial policies but also by the industrial policies of upstream and downstream industries. Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
The main terminal application field corresponding to the company's downstream customers is the wind power industry. The company's product sales are greatly affected by the installed capacity of the terminal wind power industry. Affected by the "installation rush," the company's operating income in 2020 increased by 237.49% compared to 2019. After the "grid parity" of onshore wind power in China in 2021, the pressure on the entire wind power industry chain to "reduce costs" increased, and the price of blade core materials decreased; at the same time, the installed capacity of domestic wind power also fluctuated to a certain extent compared to 2020, resulting in a 36.35% decrease in the company's operating income in 2021 compared to 2020.
If the subsequent demand for new installed capacity in the wind power industry continues to slow down or decline, leading to a significant drop in the company's income from the wind power industry, or if the profitability of the company's wind power blade core material products declines significantly, it may have a significant adverse impact on the company's operating performance. The company's operating performance is subject to the risk of fluctuations due to changes in the prosperity of downstream industries. During the reporting period, the company's comprehensive gross profit margins after deducting the impact of freight were 49.34%, 33.06%, 33.36%, and 31.74%, respectively. The company's product prices and gross profit margins are affected by various factors such as the macroeconomic environment, the status of downstream customer industries, sales conditions, and production costs. Since May 2019, the National Development and Reform Commission and the Energy Bureau have successively introduced a series of wind power grid parity policies. The wind power industry will enter the era of competitive bidding for grid access. The withdrawal of subsidies and competitive bidding for grid access will lead to lower electricity prices, which will in turn lead to lower wind power bidding prices, thereby compressing the profit margins of wind power blade manufacturers and complete machine manufacturers, putting pressure on the entire wind power industry chain to "reduce costs," which may lead to a decrease in the sales prices of the company's products and thus a decrease in gross profit margins. In recent years, with the rapid development of the wind power industry, structural foam materials, as an important raw material for wind power blades, have seen strong market demand. Currently, the main competitors in the domestic wind power blade PVC foam industry include the issuer, Sweden's Diab, Italy's Maricell, etc.; PET foam also includes regional companies with certain production capacity and market recognition, such as Shanghai Yueke.
If existing companies compete for market share through price reductions or other means, leading to intensified industry competition, or if downstream demand decreases due to macroeconomic factors, or if competitors develop more competitive products, offer better prices or services, it will intensify industry competition and affect the market share of the company's structural foam materials, thereby adversely affecting the company's operating performance.

During the reporting period, the company's operating income was 291.7024 million yuan, 376.9803 million yuan, 510.4323 million yuan, and 258.1639 million yuan, respectively. The proportion of sales revenue from the top five customers was 94.26%, 92.08%, 83.23%, and 73.31%, respectively. Among them, the proportion of sales revenue to the largest customer, NTN, was 59.18%, 52.62%, 44.52%, and 40.10%, respectively.
The downstream industry of the company mainly involves the manufacturing of constant velocity drive shafts, which has a high concentration of operators. NTN has long dominated the domestic constant velocity drive shaft market. According to its public data, NTN's market share is about 40%. Although the company continuously enhances its efforts to develop new customers, the development of new customers requires a certain cycle. If: (1) fluctuations in the automotive industry lead to a decline in the overall sales scale growth rate or even a decrease in sales in the domestic automotive market, causing a significant decline in NTN's business; (2) significant changes occur in the competitive landscape of the industry, leading to a decline in the competitiveness of the company's main customer, NTN, in the constant velocity drive shaft industry, resulting in significant adverse changes in its operating conditions, reduced market share, or even business stagnation; (3) the company's future product quality or comprehensive service capabilities fail to meet NTN's requirements, or the company's market development strategy does not align with market changes or customer needs. Any of the above situations may lead to the loss of procurement orders from the main customer, NTN, thereby causing significant adverse effects on the company's operating performance. In extreme cases, there may be a risk of a decline in operating profit by more than 50% or even a loss in the year of listing compared to the previous year. As of the date of signing this prospectus, the issuer has some houses and buildings without ownership certificates, with a total area of 1,755.26 square meters, mainly used for corridors, product testing areas, tooling molds, and scrap warehouses, accounting for 5.01% of the issuer's total self-owned housing area. These properties are not the main properties for the company's production and operation and have obtained the "Construction Project Planning Permit." As of the date of signing this prospectus, the issuer has submitted relevant documents for the real estate ownership certificate to the Xiaoshan District Real Estate Registration Service Center in Hangzhou and received a receipt of acceptance. It is currently under review by the relevant departments. Although these houses and buildings are not the main production and operation sites of the issuer, if the company cannot obtain the corresponding ownership certificates, it may face risks such as being unable to continue using the relevant properties, being penalized, and being required to pay fines, which may adversely affect the issuer's production and operation. The company's main products are used in vehicle manufacturing, and its production and operation status is closely related to the development status and trends of the automotive industry. When the macroeconomy is in a boom phase, automobile production and consumption are active, the automotive industry develops rapidly, and the demand for constant velocity drive shaft-related products increases; conversely, when the macroeconomy enters a downturn phase, automobile consumption is sluggish, the automotive industry development slows down, and the demand for constant velocity drive shaft-related products decreases. The company's main customers are well-known domestic and foreign first-tier suppliers of automotive parts and vehicle manufacturers. If affected by the cyclical fluctuations of the automotive industry, customers may reduce their order demand from the company, thereby adversely affecting the company's operating performance.

The company's revenue growth is significantly influenced by the downstream automotive market. Due to the recovery of the automotive market, substantial increase in R&D investment by automotive manufacturers, continuous improvement in the penetration rate of new energy vehicles, and smooth expansion of the company's overseas markets, the company's revenue growth rates for 2021, 2022, and the first half of 2023 were 55.13%, 41.50%, and 16.27%, respectively, showing significant growth. In 2021 and 2022, the company's revenue growth rate was high due to the substantial increase in R&D investment by automotive manufacturers. However, it declined in the first half of 2023, and the revenue growth rate may further decline in the future. Additionally, during the reporting period, the company's revenue growth mainly came from new energy vehicle design and overseas automotive design business. If the automotive market declines or the penetration rate of new energy vehicles stagnates or the company's overseas market expansion is unfavorable, the company will face the risk of declining revenue growth.

During the reporting period, the revenue from the company's fuel commercial vehicle design business accounted for 22.69%, 18.56%, 15.19%, and 14.44% of the automotive design business revenue, respectively. Affected by the "National V to National VI emission standards" and public health measures, commercial vehicle sales decreased by 6.6% and 31.2% in 2021 and 2022, respectively. In the first half of 2023, sales rebounded with a year-on-year growth of 15.8%, showing strong cyclicality. Although the company's commercial vehicle design revenue continued to grow due to continuous R&D investment by commercial vehicle customers during the reporting period and was not affected by the deterioration of downstream market sales, if the commercial vehicle market enters a downward cycle again in the future and customers reduce R&D investment, the company's revenue may not sustain high growth and may even face the risk of decline.

Domestic independent automotive design companies have a short development history and are currently in the growth stage, with fierce market competition within the industry. Although the company has accumulated talent, technology, brand, and customer resources, and its comprehensive competitiveness remains at the forefront domestically, with the continuous improvement of design levels by other domestic automotive design companies, increased support for their R&D teams by automotive manufacturers, and the intensified business expansion of foreign independent automotive design companies in the Chinese market, automotive manufacturers may reduce the outsourcing ratio of automotive design R&D, intensifying competition in the domestic automotive design market and impacting the company's existing business.

The automotive industry, to which the company belongs, is a pillar industry of the national economy, and macroeconomic changes have a significant impact on the automotive industry. The growth rate of GDP has generally maintained a positive correlation with the automotive market. From 2020 to 2022, the GDP grew by 2.2%, 8.4%, and 3.0%, respectively. The GDP growth rate in 2023 is expected to be around 5%. If the GDP growth rate declines in the future, it may lead to a decline in the automotive market, affecting the company's revenue growth.

China's automotive market experienced three consecutive years of sales decline starting in 2018 and began to recover in 2021. Affected by this, the company's revenue maintained a growth trend in 2021, 2022, and the first half of 2023. If the automotive market re-enters a downward channel in the future, it may adversely affect the company's revenue.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information: At the end of each reporting period, the company's accounts receivable balances were 81.0177 million yuan, 64.5865 million yuan, 164.387 million yuan, and 112.9693 million yuan, accounting for 21.59%, 14.79%, 20.83%, and 20.04% of the revenue for each period, respectively. During the reporting period, although the company's main customers had good credit and a good historical repayment record, with accounts receivable turnover rates of 7.69 times/year, 6.00 times/year, 6.89 times/year, and 4.07 times/year, the accounts receivable balance at the end of the period is expected to gradually increase as the company's business scale expands. If customers operate poorly or there are disputes between the parties in the future, there may be a risk of accounts receivable not being recovered in a timely manner. At the end of each reporting period, the book values of the company's inventories were 67.2677 million yuan, 99.4557 million yuan, 98.3978 million yuan, and 48.4698 million yuan, accounting for 28.38%, 37.37%, 22.39%, and 14.45% of the total assets, respectively. The company continuously adjusts its procurement and production plans dynamically according to market demand changes, ensuring a reasonable inventory level. The inventory turnover rates during the reporting period were 5.07 times/year, 4.22 times/year, 6.13 times/year, and 5.39 times/year. However, if the company fails to accurately predict market demand in the future, or due to changes in market prices, the company fails to maintain continuous and effective management of inventory, it will face the risk of inventory devaluation. The main raw materials required for the company's production are chips, power supplies, PCB boards, electronic components, etc. The proportion of chip procurement in raw materials was 50.64%, 55.93%, 58.32%, and 55.86%, respectively, while the proportion of direct materials in the main business costs during each reporting period was about 90%. Therefore, changes in chip prices are one of the main factors affecting the company's production costs. Although the company's product quotations fully consider the impact of material costs, if chip prices continue to rise significantly in the future and the company's product prices cannot be adjusted in time, it will directly affect the company's production costs and gross profit margin, bringing an adverse impact on the company's profitability. The company's final chip suppliers are mainly Taiwanese companies Realtek and MediaTek. Future uncertainties in trade conditions may affect the company's chip supply situation, causing certain operational risks. Due to the fast update speed of products in the network terminal equipment industry, the company needs to continuously develop new technologies and new products. During the reporting period, the company attached great importance to market-oriented R&D innovation investment, with R&D investment amounts of 15.0588 million yuan, 18.023 million yuan, 27.4798 million yuan, and 12.0311 million yuan, accounting for 4.01%, 4.13%, 3.48%, and 4.27% of the revenue for each period, respectively. If the company's future product innovation direction is wrong or technological innovation fails, and the technology cannot form products or achieve industrialization, the R&D investment cannot be recovered, which will have an adverse impact on the company's operations.

This includes comprehensive assessments and evaluations of suppliers' technological research and development capabilities, product quality control, rapid response capabilities, and after-sales service capabilities. After entering Apple's supply chain, the issuer's main business focuses on providing Apple Inc. and its cooperating EMS manufacturers with intelligent testing equipment and precision assembly equipment for Apple's product precision components. During the reporting period, the issuer's sales revenue mainly came from Apple's cooperating EMS manufacturers. The company's main business, sales revenue, and customer structure are dependent on Apple's supply chain. If the issuer cannot maintain a close cooperative relationship with Apple Inc. and its cooperating EMS manufacturers in the future, and fails to develop customers in other fields and achieve diversified income sources, the company's future operating performance will face significant fluctuations. The company's intelligent testing equipment and precision assembly equipment are mainly used in Apple's notebook computer-related core components, represented by touch interaction modules. If market competition intensifies in the future, Apple's product design and functional features fail to gain recognition from end consumers, or Apple's marketing strategies, pricing strategies, and other business strategies make mistakes and cannot be adjusted for a long time, or if the downstream notebook computer industry experiences a large-scale contraction, it may affect the sales of Apple's products, which in turn will affect the related intelligent testing equipment and precision assembly equipment, thereby having a significant adverse impact on the company's operating performance. The issuer's core products, intelligent testing equipment and precision assembly equipment, have customized attributes, and continuous technological research and development is the key to timely and quickly responding to customers' customized needs. The downstream industry is characterized by high innovation, fast technological innovation, and short product replacement cycles, which puts higher demands on the company's technical reserves, rapid research and development, and differentiated production capabilities. If the company's product research and design capabilities cannot keep up with the pace of downstream industry and technological iteration, the company faces the risk of its technology and products being replaced by competitors, leading to customer loss, thereby adversely affecting the company's revenue scale and profitability. If the company's project research and development fails in the future, or the related technology fails to form products or achieve industrialization, it will have a significant adverse impact on the company's operating performance. If the company's product research and development level improves slowly, or if there is a major change in downstream touch interaction technology and the company cannot timely develop new technologies, new processes, and new products to match it, the core technology currently mastered by the company may be replaced by more advanced technology in the same industry, thereby having a significant adverse impact on the company's future business development.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
The company, with optoelectronic signal transmission technology as its core, is mainly engaged in the research and development, production, and sales of signal transmission connection products, electroacoustic products, and 3C supporting products. In recent years, the consumer electronics industry has shown characteristics of short upgrade cycles and rapid changes in consumer preferences. If the company cannot quickly grasp market changes in the consumer electronics field and develop new products that meet customer needs, or if there are deviations in predicting market development trends, the company may face customer loss, which may lead to a decline in the company's revenue scale and competitiveness. As of the date of signing this prospectus, the company's production and operation site located at Jinghai West Road, Chang'an Town, Dongguan City, Guangdong Province, is leased, with a building area of 22,613 square meters and a lease term from May 1, 2023, to April 30, 2025. These leased factory buildings have not yet obtained property ownership certificates, and there are defects in the property rights. The issuer may be required to relocate in the future, so there is a risk of being unable to continue using the factory buildings. The company's products are mainly exported. During the reporting period, the company's main business income from overseas was 481.7575 million yuan, 607.1109 million yuan, 562.3666 million yuan, and 248.7121 million yuan, accounting for 71.31%, 72.80%, 65.16%, and 68.67% of the company's main business income, respectively, with the US market being one of the main sales markets for the company's products.
During the reporting period, some of the company's products were on the list of additional tariffs in the United States. Due to the ever-changing international situation, if China and the United States fail to reach friendly consultations in the future, and trade frictions continue for a long time or even further escalate, and the company cannot take effective countermeasures, the price competitiveness of the company's products may be weakened, American consumers' demand for the company's products may decrease, and the company's operating performance may be adversely affected.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information: In recent years, new technologies in the field of life sciences have continuously emerged, driving the advancement of the pharmaceutical industry and bringing competitive pressure to CRO companies. The company focuses on antibody expression, antibody discovery, and optimization services, and has developed high-throughput antibody expression platforms, antibody discovery and optimization platforms, and stable cell line construction platforms. If the company cannot continuously strengthen its technological research and development and the construction of its technical talent team, and cannot maintain timely updates and investments in experimental equipment, it may lead to the company's inability to enhance its technical platforms, putting it at a disadvantage in future market competition, thereby affecting the company's future profitability and sustainable development capabilities. With the rapid development and increasing maturity of antibody drugs, industry competition continues to escalate. The competition among CRO service providers has upgraded from completing basic subcontracting tasks to empowering new drug research and development; in addition, internationalization and one-stop service capabilities have also set higher requirements for CRO service providers. The company mainly focuses on antibody expression and antibody discovery and optimization businesses, and has initially acquired the ability to provide one-stop services in the field of antibody discovery. However, due to the company's small size and specialized business, there is still a significant gap in providing one-stop services compared to leading CRO companies in the industry. If the company cannot continuously improve its technical level, research and development capabilities, and service quality, its competitive advantage and profitability will be adversely affected by intensified market competition. The company has established multiple core platform technologies around antibody discovery and optimization services and has mastered a series of proprietary technologies (Know-how). These technologies stem from years of internal research and development and service experience accumulation, ensuring the company's continuous innovation and profitability, and are an important manifestation of the company's market competitiveness. Since proprietary technologies are not suitable for patent protection and cannot be legally protected to maintain the company's technical secrets, there is a risk of core technology leakage. Even if the company seeks judicial protection, it will consume a large amount of human and material resources, which will adversely affect the company's production and operations. During the reporting period, the company's comprehensive gross profit margins were 76.66%, 73.72%, 65.88%, and 64.24%, respectively. Although the company's gross profit margin has declined, it remains at a high level. In the company's future development process, if there are significant adverse changes in domestic and foreign policy environments, intensified market competition, and rising labor and manufacturing costs, it will lead to a decrease in the company's bargaining power and an increase in production costs, which may further reduce the company's gross profit margin and affect the company's overall profitability.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
In August 2021, the National Development and Reform Commission issued the "Barometer of the Completion of Dual Control Targets for Energy Consumption in Various Regions in the First Half of 2021," listing multiple provinces (regions, cities) as warning areas for dual control of energy consumption; in September 2021, the National Development and Reform Commission released the "Plan to Improve the Dual Control System for Energy Consumption Intensity and Total Volume," which put forward specific requirements for energy consumption intensity and total volume. Against this backdrop, many local governments have successively introduced policies on production and power restrictions.

The issuer's main production and operation location is in Guangdong Province, which is a first-level warning area for dual control of energy consumption. If future power and production restriction measures continue to tighten, the issuer's normal production and operation may be adversely affected, mainly including: on the sales side, it may lead to the company being unable to deliver products on time according to order requirements, downstream customers delaying or reducing orders due to their own power restrictions; on the production side, it may cause upstream suppliers to limit production, leading to the inability to supply main raw materials on time, rising raw material prices, and idling of the company's production facilities.

During each reporting period, the proportion of the company's overseas sales revenue to main business income was 2.20%, 11.49%, 23.60%, and 42.36%, respectively. Although during the reporting period, there were no cases of major importing countries setting trade barriers or trade frictions, in recent years, influenced by geopolitical factors, trade protectionism has been on the rise. If such situations further deteriorate, it may adversely affect the company's production and operation.

The company's product research and development and production largely rely on professional talents, and maintaining the stability of core technical personnel with rich industry experience is an important guarantee for the company's survival and sustainable development. At the end of each reporting period, the number of the company's R&D personnel was 89, 129, 135, and 132, accounting for 11.70%, 13.95%, 16.05%, and 16.10% of the total number of employees, respectively. With the development of China's dyeing and finishing equipment industry, competition for industry talents is becoming increasingly fierce. If the company fails to continuously provide competitive treatment and working environment, it may face the risk of losing technical personnel in the future, thereby affecting the company's technological innovation capability and causing adverse effects on the company's operating performance and long-term development.

During the reporting period, the company's operating income was 573.0926 million yuan, 720.5799 million yuan, 686.3202 million yuan, and 361.8778 million yuan, respectively, and the net profit attributable to shareholders of the parent company was 117.2714 million yuan, 163.8554 million yuan, 96.1334 million yuan, and 55.6972 million yuan, respectively. In 2022, the company's operating performance experienced a significant decline, with operating income down 4.75% year-on-year and net profit attributable to shareholders of the parent company down 41.33% year-on-year, mainly due to the impact of changes in the macroeconomic environment leading to a decline in the prosperity of the downstream textile industry, the continuous high operation of steel and other raw material prices, and the continuous increase in the company's R&D investment.

In the future, the development trend of the macroeconomic environment and the price changes of production factors are highly uncertain. If the relevant adverse factors cannot be eliminated, and the company fails to take timely and effective countermeasures, it will adversely affect the company's profitability, leading to the risk of fluctuations and declines in the company's operating performance.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
The company is a pharmaceutical enterprise specializing in the development of drugs for central nervous system diseases. Based on the evolution of industry technology and market development trends, the company continuously develops new technologies and new products. As of the date of signing this prospectus, the company has a total of 18 major research projects focusing on central nervous system diseases, covering 7 improved new drugs and 11 high-end generic drugs. Due to the possibility of changes in drug market demand over time, it cannot be ruled out that the company's research products may face the possibility of commercial value being lower than expected after approval and listing. At the same time, since the progress and success rate of drug research and development are affected by many factors such as preclinical research, clinical research, and drug market review and approval, the progress of the company's research products in the future may also be surpassed by competitors or may fail to be approved due to research and development failures.
In summary, if the company terminates research projects or the commercial value after listing is lower than expected due to delays in research project progress or failure to obtain approval, it will adversely affect the company's operating performance, profitability, and growth. According to the "Guiding Opinions of the National Medical Security Administration on Establishing a Credit Evaluation System for Drug Prices and Procurement" (Medical Insurance Issuance [2020] No. 34) issued by the National Medical Security Administration in August 2020, the National Medical Security Administration has established a list of dishonest items for drug prices and procurement, which is dynamically adjusted. The dishonest items included in the list mainly include giving kickbacks or other improper benefits in drug purchases and sales, tax-related violations, monopolistic behavior, improper pricing behavior, disrupting centralized procurement order, maliciously violating contract agreements, and other behaviors contrary to honesty and credit. At the same time, provincial centralized procurement agencies implement credit ratings based on reliable sources, clear conditions, standardized procedures, and strict operations. According to the nature, circumstances, timeliness, and impact of dishonest behavior, the dishonest situation of pharmaceutical companies in the local bidding procurement market is rated as general, medium, serious, and particularly serious, and dynamically updated every quarter. Provincial centralized procurement agencies take disposal measures based on the credit rating of pharmaceutical companies, such as written reminders and warnings, relying on the centralized procurement platform to inform purchasers of risk information, restricting or suspending the listing of related drugs or medical consumables, restricting or suspending the procurement of related drugs or medical consumables, and disclosing dishonest information. If the number of provinces involved in dishonest behavior reaches the specified conditions, the National Medical Security Administration's Drug Price and Bidding Procurement Guidance Center will initiate nationwide joint disposal. If the supply structure of the involved drugs or medical consumables is single and the supply-demand situation is tense, graded disposal measures will be taken on the basis of ensuring supply.
If the company engages in pharmaceutical commercial bribery, tax-related violations, monopolistic behavior, improper pricing behavior, disrupting centralized procurement order, maliciously violating contract agreements, and other behaviors contrary to honesty and credit in the future, the company will face the risk of being included in the list of dishonest items for drug prices and procurement, which will adversely affect the company's operations.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
During the reporting period, the company's main business was solar cells and distributed photovoltaic power station business. The customers of solar cells are mainly downstream module manufacturers. Due to the characteristics of the industry, the company's solar cell business has a high customer concentration. During the reporting period, the sales revenue of the company's top five solar cell customers accounted for 36.90%, 68.39%, 66.62%, and 64.62% of the operating income, respectively. Although the main customers of the company's solar cell business are well-known module manufacturers with good reputations, and under normal circumstances, the company will maintain a long-term stable cooperative relationship with them after becoming a qualified supplier of the above-mentioned well-known module manufacturers through strict certification, if the main customers of the company experience adverse changes in their business or financial conditions, or if the stable cooperative relationship between the company and the main customers undergoes adverse changes, it may have an adverse impact on the company's operating performance.
During the reporting period, the company needed to procure raw materials such as silicon wafers and slurry for solar cells. Due to the characteristics of the industry, the company's supplier concentration is high. During the reporting period, the procurement proportion of the company's top five suppliers for the solar cell business was 57.35%, 75.15%, 73.72%, and 74.69%, respectively. The company's procurement proportion from major suppliers is relatively high. If the main suppliers have insufficient supply or quality issues with the supplied materials, China is a major producer of photovoltaic products, with a high proportion of photovoltaic product output globally. In 2022, China's production proportions of polysilicon, silicon wafers, cells, and modules accounted for 85.6%, 97.4%, 90.3%, and 84.8% of the global total, respectively. In recent years, with the emphasis on energy security by various countries and the emphasis on localization of production and supply chains, the photovoltaic industry has gradually become the focus of various countries in building energy supply security and supply chain internal circulation systems. On the one hand, major countries and regions have comprehensively implemented policies to strongly promote the localization of photovoltaic manufacturing. On the other hand, some photovoltaic product importing countries have successively started anti-dumping and countervailing investigations on Chinese photovoltaic products, planning or implementing policies to impose high anti-dumping and countervailing duties, and conducting investigations on behaviors that evade "double anti" policies. In the future, if trade frictions occur between China and major photovoltaic product importing countries, it will affect the overseas sales of Chinese photovoltaic products, especially photovoltaic modules, which will in turn affect the market demand for upstream cells, thereby adversely affecting the company's future operating performance.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
During the reporting period, the amounts of raw materials purchased by the company from the top five suppliers were 295.2618 million yuan, 638.4053 million yuan, 1,883.4369 million yuan, and 1,230.2506 million yuan, accounting for 65.53%, 83.25%, 78.87%, and 84.47% of the total raw material purchases for the period, respectively. The company's POE resin is mainly supplied by overseas chemical companies such as Mitsui Chemicals, LG Chem, and Dow Chemical, while EVA resin is mainly supplied by domestic and overseas chemical companies such as Lianhong New Science & Technology, Zhejiang Petrochemical, and Hanwha Total. To ensure the supply of raw materials and reduce the impact of raw material price fluctuations on operations, the company has maintained long-term stable cooperation with major raw material suppliers. If there are significant adverse changes in the production and operation of major raw material suppliers or their cooperation with the company, the company will face risks such as fluctuations in raw material purchase prices, insufficient or untimely supply, which will adversely affect the company's production and operations. At the end of each reporting period, the book values of the company's inventory were 43.9301 million yuan, 114.4826 million yuan, 664.2442 million yuan, and 852.7967 million yuan, mainly consisting of raw materials and goods in transit. During the reporting period, the company's product sales prices and raw material prices fluctuated significantly, resulting in the risk of inventory write-down losses. The amounts of inventory write-downs at the end of each reporting period were 337,200 yuan, 3.0833 million yuan, 25.2328 million yuan, and 13.2933 million yuan. In the fourth quarter of 2022, the price of EVA raw materials dropped significantly, and the company's EVA film sales prices quickly fell in line with the current raw material purchase prices. The cost of inventory lagged behind, resulting in the net realizable value of inventory being lower than the carrying cost. At the end of 2022, the company's inventory write-downs amounted to 25.2328 million yuan. If the prices of the company's main raw materials fluctuate significantly in the future, the company will face the risk of inventory impairment, which will adversely affect the company's operating performance. The company's film products are mainly used in the photovoltaic industry, which, as a green and clean energy source, has good development prospects. As a strategic emerging industry, the photovoltaic industry is influenced by factors such as macroeconomic conditions, industrial policies, the balanced development of various links in the industrial chain, market demand, and the comparative advantages of other energy sources, and its development has certain volatility characteristics. If the development of the photovoltaic industry fluctuates in the future, leading to a decline in the demand for photovoltaic films, it will adversely affect the company's operations.
In recent years, the photovoltaic film market in China has developed rapidly, with major participating companies actively developing new products and expanding production capacity to maintain or gain larger market shares, further intensifying market competition. With technological development and performance improvement, downstream photovoltaic module manufacturers will increasingly emphasize the protective and encapsulating functions of films, and market competition will fully unfold around product quality, technological research and development, market marketing, and financial strength. If the company cannot take effective measures to actively respond to the increasingly fierce market competition, it will adversely affect its operating performance.

The company is a high-tech enterprise mainly engaged in the research and development, production, and sales of explosion-proof industrial dust removal equipment. With the acceleration of production process changes, downstream industries such as lithium batteries and photovoltaics have put forward higher requirements for dust treatment processes, dust removal efficiency, and explosion-proof performance, promoting industrial dust removal equipment companies to further innovate their product processes and technologies. On the one hand, the company needs to grasp the development trend of dust explosion-proof technology; on the other hand, it must continuously meet the changing performance requirements of dust removal equipment due to the production process innovations in downstream industries. Therefore, the company needs to carry out continuous technological innovation and iterative product development. If the company cannot accurately grasp the trends in technology, products, and the market in the future, or if there is a significant deviation in understanding these trends, it will affect the company's sustained competitiveness.

In recent years, the company's production and operation scale has rapidly expanded, the asset scale has correspondingly increased, and the personnel has also been rapidly expanding, putting higher demands on the operational capabilities, market expansion, resource integration, and internal control of the company's management team. However, with the continued development of the company's business, especially after this issuance and listing and the commissioning of the fundraising investment projects, the company's production and operation scale will further expand. If the company's relevant management measures cannot adapt to the rapid expansion of the company's scale, and the talent reserve and management level cannot adapt to the development changes of the company's internal and external environment, the company may face management risks caused by the rapid expansion of the operating scale.

During the reporting period, the company's operating income mainly came from the lithium battery industry. In recent years, downstream lithium battery manufacturers have significantly expanded production, continuously increasing battery capacity, driving the rapid growth of demand in the upstream battery equipment market. Therefore, the company's income from the lithium battery industry also increased significantly in 2022. If the growth rate of the lithium battery industry slows down or declines in the future, the market demand for the company's products in the lithium battery field will be affected. If the company's other business areas do not achieve good results at the same time, it will adversely affect the company's performance.

Prospectus_Risk_Detection.information:
The company's products are mainly aimed at strategic emerging industries such as new energy vehicles, charging piles, photovoltaic energy storage, and data communication. These industries are characterized by relatively fast technological upgrades and product iterations. As the new energy industry continues to develop, the requirements for power conversion, control, and usage efficiency are constantly increasing, and power electronic components are continuously developing towards high power density and high conversion efficiency.

With the continuous development of downstream industries, rapid technological upgrades in the industry, and intensified market competition, customers have increasingly higher requirements for the R&D innovation capabilities of magnetic components and charging module manufacturing enterprises in product development, design, material selection, and manufacturing processes. If the company cannot continuously maintain the innovation of technology and products or misjudges the industry technology trends and market product demands, it may lead to the company's new technologies and new products not being recognized by customers, failing to meet the rapid development needs of downstream industries, losing advantages in the increasingly fierce industry competition, and thus adversely affecting the company's development. As of the signing date of this prospectus, the company's production and operation sites and the locations proposed for the expansion and fundraising projects are all obtained through leasing, and some of them have not yet obtained property certificates from the lessor. If in the future, due to the above-mentioned leasing defects, the properties cannot be used normally, the factory lease expires and cannot be renewed, suitable replacement factories cannot be quickly found after the expiration, or other situations affecting the normal use of leased factories occur, it may adversely affect the stability of the company's production and operation and the implementation of fundraising projects.

At the end of each reporting period, the book value of the company's inventory was 79.7204 million yuan, 128.2454 million yuan, 175.4538 million yuan, and 168.5188 million yuan, accounting for 32.80%, 36.58%, 36.16%, and 33.90% of current assets, respectively, which is relatively high. With the further growth of sales revenue and asset scale, the company's inventory will also increase accordingly. If adverse changes occur in the future market operating environment, raw material prices, product market demand, etc., leading to price drops, backlog, and unsalable inventory, the company will face the risk of inventory impairment and provision for price drops, which will adversely affect the financial status.

During the reporting period, the proportion of direct material costs to the main business costs of the company was 59.16%, 59.67%, 62.71%, and 63.97%, respectively, and the prices of raw materials have a significant impact on the main business costs. The main raw materials for the company's magnetic component products include wires, magnetic materials, and insulating materials, while the main raw materials for charging module products include semiconductors, capacitors, and PCB boards. Among them, the purchase amount of wires and magnetic materials accounts for a relatively high proportion of the company's total raw material purchases, with a combined proportion of 64.01%, 65.81%, 63.61%, and 58.99% in each period, respectively.

Wires and magnetic materials are greatly affected by bulk material price fluctuations. Assuming other factors remain unchanged, if the purchase prices of wires and magnetic materials change by 5% in 2022, according to the company's hypothetical calculations, the impact on the company's total profit would be 6.71% and 5.37%, respectively. If the prices of major raw materials fluctuate sharply in the short term in the future, and the company cannot effectively pass on the pressure of rising raw material prices or cannot offset the pressure of rising raw material costs through technological process innovation, or fails to manage inventory well when prices fall, it will squeeze the product profit margin and may adversely affect the company's operating performance.
